1.verse: The Book of Judgment -Indictment of Israel and Judah -Chapter 1 -The Sins of Israel. -The vision of Isaiah, the son of Amoz, concerning Judah and Jerusalem which he received during the reigns of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

2.verse: Listen, O heavens, and pay close attention, O earth,for the Lord is speaking.I reared children and brought them up,but they have rebelled against me.

3.verse: An ox knows its ownerand the donkey its master’s stall,but Israel does not know,my people do not understand.

4.verse: You are a sinful nation,a people weighed down with iniquity,a race of evildoerswhose children are corrupt;you have forsaken the Lord,despised the Holy One of Israel,and turned your backs on him.

5.verse: Why do you continue to seek further beatings?Why do you persist in your rebellion?Your entire head is sickand your whole heart is faint.

6.verse: From the sole of your foot to your headthere is not a single healthy areanothing but bruises and welts and open soresthat have not been drained or bandagedor soothed with ointment.

7.verse: Your country is a desolate waste,and fire has destroyed your cities.Before your very eyesforeigners have devoured your landand left it as desolateas Sodom after it had been overthrown.

8.verse: Daughter Zion is leftlike a shack in a vineyard,like a shed in a field of cucumbers,like a besieged city.

9.verse: If the Lord of hostshad not left us a few survivors,we would have become like Sodomand been like Gomorrah.

10.verse: Hear the word of the Lord,you rulers of Sodom.Listen to the teaching of our God,you people of Gomorrah.

11.verse: What do I care about your unceasing sacrifices?says the Lord.I am weary of burnt offerings of ramsand the fat of well-fed animals.I derive no delight in the bloodof bulls and lambs and goats.

12.verse: When you come into my presence,who has asked you to present such offerings?Never again trample my courts!

13.verse: To bring me offerings is futile;I regard your incense as loathsome.New moons and Sabbaths and sacred assemblies—I cannot tolerate your iniquity that accompanies them.

14.verse: I loathe your new moons and your festivals;they have become a burden to meand I can no longer endure bearing them.

15.verse: When you stretch out your hands,I will turn away my eyes from you.Even if you pray endlessly,I will not listen,for your hands are covered with blood.

16.verse: Wash yourselves and become clean;remove your evil deedsfar from my sight.Cease to do evil

17.verse: and learn to do good.Pursue justice and rescue the oppressed;listen to the plea of the orphanand defend the widow.

18.verse: Come now and let us discuss this,says the Lord.Though your sins are like scarlet,they shall be like snow.Though they are as red as crimson,they shall become as white as wool.

19.verse: If you are willing to obey,you will eat the best foodthat the land has to offer.

20.verse: However, if you refuse and rebel,the sword will devour you,for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.

21.verse: How the faithful cityhas become an adulteress,she who used to be a symbol of justice.Righteousness used to dwell in her,but now she is the abode of murderers.

22.verse: Your silver has turned to dross,and your wine is mixed with water.

23.verse: Your princes are rebelsand companions of thieves.All of them love bribesand are eager to receive gifts.They do not treat the orphan with justice,and they refuse to listen to the pleas of widows.

24.verse: Therefore, the Lord of hosts,the Mighty One of Israel, says this:I am determined to vent my anger upon my enemiesand wreak vengeance on my foes.

25.verse: I will turn my hand against youand refine your dross in the furnace,purging all of your impurities.

26.verse: And I will restore your judgesas in the days of oldand your counselors as at the beginning.Then you will be called the city of righteousness,the faithful city.

27.verse: Zion will be redeemed by judgmentand those who are repentant by righteousness.

28.verse: But rebels and sinners alike will be destroyed,and those who forsake the Lord will perish.

29.verse: You will be ashamed of the sacred oakswhich offered you such delight,and you will blush when you behold the gardenswhich you chose in their stead.

30.verse: You will be like a tree whose leaves are withered,like a garden without water.

31.verse: The strong man will become like strawand his work like a spark.Both will burn together,and no one will be able to quench the flames.

1.verse: The Internal Decadence of a People -Chapter 2 -Jerusalem, the Religious Center. -This is the vision seen by Isaiah, the son of Amoz, concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

2.verse: In days to comethe mountain of the Lord’s housewill be established as the highest mountainand raised high above the hills.Then all the nations will stream toward it;

3.verse: many peoples will come to it and say,“Come, let us ascend the mountain of the Lord,to the house of the God of Jacob,so that he may teach us his waysand we may walk in his paths.”For from Zion will go forth instruction,and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem.

4.verse: He will judge between the nationsand serve as an arbiter for many peoples.They will beat their swords into plowsharesand their spears into pruning hooks.One nation will not lift up a sword against another,nor will they ever again be trained for war.

5.verse: The Lord’s Triumph Will Come -Come, O house of Jacob,let us walk in the light of the Lord.

6.verse: For you, O Lord, have abandoned your people,the house of Jacob.They are surrounded by fortune tellersand by soothsayers like the Philistines,and they are allying themselves with foreigners.

7.verse: Their land is full of silver and gold,and their treasures are without limit.Their land is filled with horses,and there is no end to their chariots.

8.verse: Their land is full of idols;they bow down before the work of their hands,before what their own fingers have fashioned.

9.verse: Therefore human nature has been humbledand mankind has been brought low;do not forgive them.

10.verse: Let them conceal themselves among the rocksand hide in the dustin their terror of the Lordand from the splendor of his majesty.

11.verse: The haughty looks of men will be brought lowand human arrogance will be humbled;the Lord alone will be exaltedon that day.

12.verse: For the Lord of hosts has ordained a dayagainst all those who are proud and haughty,against all those who have been exalted and raised high,

13.verse: against all the lofty and proud cedars of Lebanonand against all the oaks of Bashan,

14.verse: against all the soaring mountainsand all the towering hills,

15.verse: against every high towerand every fortified wall,

16.verse: against all the ships of Tarshishand every stately vessel.

17.verse: Human pride will be humbledand human arrogance will be brought low.On that day,the Lord alone will be exalted.

18.verse: The idols will completely disappear;

19.verse: they will crawl into the caves of the rocksand the holes of the ground,fleeing from the terror of the Lordand the splendor of his majestywhen he arises to strike the world with terror.

20.verse: On that day people will throw awayto the moles and to the batstheir idols of silver and goldthat they had made for themselves to worship.

21.verse: They will crawl into the crevices of the rocksand the clefts in the cliffsto hide from the terror of the Lordand the splendor of his majestywhen he arises to terrify the earth.

22.verse: Have nothing more to do with menwho have only the breath in their nostrils.Of what value are they?

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Ruling against Judah and Jerusalem -Now the Lord, the Lord of hosts,is about to deprive Jerusalem and Judahof resources and provisions—all supplies of bread and water—

2.verse: warriors and soldiers,judges and prophets,fortune tellers and elders,

3.verse: captains and dignitaries,counselors, skilled magicians,and expert enchanters.

4.verse: I will appoint young boys as their princes,mere lads to rule over them.

5.verse: People will oppress one another,each one ill-treated by his neighbor.The young will be arrogant toward their elders,as will the lowly toward the honorable.

6.verse: A man will take hold of his brotherin their father’s house, saying,“You have a cloak;you will be our leader,and this heap of ruinswill be under your rule.”

7.verse: But on that daythe other will cry out, saying,“I am not qualified to undertake this;in my house there is neither bread nor clothing.You will not make me leader of the people.”

8.verse: Jerusalem has been brought lowand Judah has fallenbecause by their words and their deedsthey turned against the Lordand defied his glorious presence.

9.verse: The look on their faces bears witness against them;they proclaim their sins like Sodomwithout any effort to conceal them.Woe to them!For they have brought disaster upon themselves.

10.verse: Happy are the righteous,for they will eat the fruit of their labors.

11.verse: Woe to the wicked.All will go ill with them.They will be repaidas their actions deserve.

12.verse: O my people, children are oppressing youand women have become your rulers.O my people, your rulers are leading you astrayand putting you on the road to ruin.

13.verse: The Lord has risen to argue his case;he stands up to judge his people.

14.verse: The Lord enters into judgmentagainst the elders and the princes of his people:It is you who have ravaged the vineyard;the spoils you have taken from the poorare in your houses.

15.verse: What right do you have to crush my peopleand grind the faces of the poor?says the Lord God of hosts.

16.verse: The Lord said:Because the daughters of Zion are haughty,walking with their heads held high,glancing wantonly with their eyes,moving provocatively with mincing stepsand with their anklets tinkling,

17.verse: the Lord will cover with scabsthe scalps of the daughters of Zion,and he will lay bare their foreheads.

18.verse: On that day the Lord will take away their finery: anklets, headbands, and crescents;

19.verse: pendants, bracelets, and shawls;

20.verse: headdresses, bangles, necklaces, perfume boxes, and amulets;

21.verse: signet rings and nose rings;

22.verse: fine dresses, wraps, cloaks, and purses;

23.verse: mirrors, linen garments, turbans, and veils.

24.verse: Then instead of perfume there will be a stench,and instead of a sash, a rope;instead of a lovely hair setting, baldness,instead of a rich gown, a sackcloth dress,and instead of beauty, branding marks.

25.verse: O Zion, your men will fall by the swordand your warriors will perish in battle.

26.verse: Your gates will lament and mourn;ravaged, you will sit desolate on the ground.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -On that day,seven women will take hold of one man, saying,“We will eat our own foodand provide for our own clothing.Just let us bear your name.Take away our disgrace.”

2.verse: The Seed of the Lord -On that day the branch of the Lordwill be beautiful and glorious,and the fruit of the landwill be the pride and splendorof the survivors of Israel.

3.verse: Whoever is left in Zionand whoever remains in Jerusalemwill be called holy,everyone whose survival in Jerusalem was decreed.

4.verse: When the Lord has washed awaythe filth of the daughters of Zionand cleansed the bloodstains of Jerusalem from its midstby a spirit of judgment and of cleansing,

5.verse: then the Lord will createover every house on Mount Zion,and over those who assemble there,a cloud of smoke by dayand a bright flame of fire by night.The glory of the Lord will be a canopy over all,

6.verse: serving as a shade by day from the heatand a refuge and a shelter from the storm and the rain.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -The Song of the Vineyard -Now let me sing for my belovedthe song of my friend concerning his vineyard.My beloved had a vineyardon a fertile hillside.

2.verse: He dug it, cleared it of stones,and planted it with choice red vines.In its midst he built a watchtowerand also hewed out a winepress.He expected it to yield a rich crop of grapes,but the only thing it brought forth was wild grapes.

3.verse: And now, inhabitants of Jerusalem and people of Judah,I ask you to judge between me and my vineyard.

4.verse: What more could I have done for my vineyardthat I did not do?When I expected it to yield choice grapes,why did it bring forth wild grapes?

5.verse: Now listen to me as I tell youwhat I am planning to do to my vineyard.I will take away its hedgeand use it for grazing.I will knock down its walland let it be trampled upon.

6.verse: I will let it go to waste;it will be neither pruned nor hoed,but left overgrown with briars and thorns.I will also command the cloudsnot to allow any rain to fall upon it.

7.verse: The vineyard of the Lord of hostsis the house of Israel,and the people of Judahare the plant he cherished.He expected justice but found bloodshed;he expected righteousness but heard cries of distress.

8.verse: The Doom of Sinners -Woe to you who add house to houseand join field to fielduntil there is no further space remainingand you are left to dwell alonein the midst of the land.

9.verse: The Lord of hosts in my hearinghas sworn this solemn oath:Many houses will be left desolate,large and fine mansionswith no one to inhabit them.

10.verse: For ten acres of vineyardwill yield only one barrel,and ten bushels of seedwill yield only a single bushel.

11.verse: Woe to those who rise early in the morningto imbibe strong drink,and who linger far into the nightinflamed with wine.

12.verse: Their feasts are marked with harps and lyres,tambourines and flutes and wine.But they never give thought to the deeds of the Lord,or note what his hands have accomplished.

13.verse: Therefore, my people shall end up in exilebecause they have no knowledge of my deeds.Their nobles are dying of hungerand their masses are parched with thirst.

14.verse: As a result, the netherworld has increased its appetiteand opened its jaws to an immeasurable extent,swallowing the nobility of Jerusalem and her masses,her throngs and all who exult in her.

15.verse: People are bowed down, everyone is brought low,and the eyes of the haughty are humbled.

16.verse: But the Lord of hosts is exalted by his judgment,and by righteousness the holy God has displayed his holiness.

17.verse: Lambs will graze there as in their pasture,and yearlings will feed among the ruins.

18.verse: Woe to those who drag iniquity alongwith the cords of perversity,and who drag sin alongas though with cart ropes;

19.verse: woe to those who say, “Let the Lord make hasteand speed up his work that we may see it;let the Holy One of Israelbe brought to fulfillmentso that we may know it.”

20.verse: Woe to those who call good what is eviland call evil what is good,who classify as darkness what is lightand designate as light what is darkness,who make sweet what is bitterand make bitter what is sweet.

21.verse: Woe to those who are wise in their own eyesand consider themselves to be prudent.

22.verse: Woe to those who are unmatched in their consumption of wineand unsurpassed in mixing drinks,

23.verse: who accept bribes to acquit the guiltyand deny justice to the innocent.

24.verse: As tongues of fire devour the stubble,and as dry grass shrivels in the flames,so their root will decayand their blossoms will be scattered like dust;for they have rejected the law of the Lord of hostsand scorned the word of the Holy One of Israel.

25.verse: Therefore, the anger of the Lordblazed forth against his people;he raised his hand against themand struck them down.The mountains quaked,and their corpses lay like refuse in the streets.But despite all thishis anger has not been sated,and his hand is still stretched out.

26.verse: Deliverance -He will deliver a signal to a far-distant nationand summon them from the ends of the earth;they will respond swiftly without any delay.

27.verse: None of them are weary, none of them stumble,no one slumbers or sleeps.None of them have their belts unfastenedor sandals with a broken strap.

28.verse: Their arrows are sharpenedand all their bows are bent.The hoofs of their horses seem like flint,and their chariot wheels are like a whirlwind.

29.verse: Their roar is like that of a lion;they growl like young lions.They roar as they seize their prey,and no one can prevent them from carrying it off.

30.verse: They will roar over it on that day,similar to the roaring of the sea.And if anyone looks at the land,he will behold only darkness and distress,with the light fading at the approaching clouds.

1.verse: The Book of Immanuel -Chapter 6 -Isaiah’s Call. -In the year that King Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a high and lofty throne, and the train of his robe filled the temple.

2.verse: In attendance above him were seraphim. Each of them had six wings: with two they covered their faces, with two they covered their feet, and with the third pair they flew.

3.verse: And they called out to one another,“Holy, holy, holy is the Lord of hosts.The entire earth is filled with his glory.”

4.verse: The voices of those who called out shook the thresholds, and the temple was filled with smoke.

5.verse: Then I said,“Woe is me! I am doomed.For I am a man of unclean lips,and I live among a people of unclean lips,yet my eyes have seen the King, the Lord of hosts.”

6.verse: Then one of the seraphim flew to me, holding in his hand a burning coal that he had removed from the altar with a pair of tongs.

7.verse: He touched my mouth with it and said,“Now that this has touched your lips,your guilt has been removedand your sin has been blotted out.”

8.verse: I then heard the voice of the Lord saying, “Whom shall I send? Who will go for us?” I said, “Here I am. Send me!”

9.verse: Then he replied: Go forth and tell this people:No matter how carefully you listen,you will not understand.You will continue to look,but you will not comprehend.

10.verse: Make the minds of this people dull;stop up their earsand close their eyes.Otherwise their eyes will see,their ears will hear,their hearts will understand,and they will change their waysand be healed.

11.verse: Then I asked, “How long, O Lord?” He replied:Until the cities lie in ruinsand become deserted,until the houses are unoccupiedand the land lies completely desolate,

12.verse: until the Lord drives the people far awayand the country will be totally abandoned.

13.verse: Even if a tenth of the people remain there,that area too will be destroyed,like a terebinth or an oakwhose stump remains when it is felled;the holy seed is its stump.

1.verse: Chapter 7 -The Coming of Immanuel. -During the period when Ahaz, the son of Jotham and the grandson of Uzziah, was king of Judah, King Rezin of Aram and King Pekah of Israel, the son of Remaliah, went forth to conquer Jerusalem, but they were unable to mount an attack against it.

2.verse: When the house of David was informed that Aram had pitched camp in Ephraim, the heart of King Ahaz and the hearts of his people began to tremble just as trees of the forest shake in the wind.

3.verse: Then the Lord said to Isaiah: Go forth with your son Shear-jashub to meet Ahaz at the end of the conduit of the upper pool, on the road to the Fuller’s Field,

4.verse: and say to him, Pay close attention to me. Remain calm and be unafraid. Do not let your courage fail because of these two smoldering stumps of firewood. Do not yield to the fierce anger of Rezin and Aram and the son of Remaliah,

5.verse: or become fearful because Aram, Ephraim, and the son of Remaliah have been plotting against you and saying,

6.verse: “Let us go forth and attack Judah. Let us tear it apart, force it to surrender to us, and appoint the son of Tabeel there as king.”

7.verse: Therefore, thus says the Lord God:This will not happen,either now or ever.

8.verse: For the head of Aram is Damascusand the head of Damascus is Rezin.The head of Ephraim is Samaria,and the head of Samaria is the son of Remaliah.

9.verse: Within sixty-five yearsEphraim will no longer be a people.If you do not stand firm in your faithyou will not stand firm at all.

10.verse: Again the Lord spoke to Ahaz, saying:

11.verse: Ask the Lord, your God for a sign;let it be as deep as the netherworldor as high as the heavens.

12.verse: But Ahaz replied, “I will not ask. I will not put the Lord to the test.”

13.verse: Then Isaiah said:Listen, O house of David!Are you not satisfied to try the patience of men?Must you also try the patience of my God?

14.verse: Therefore, you will be given this signby the Lord himself:The virgin will be with child,and she will give birth to a son,and she will name him Immanuel.

15.verse: He will feed on curds and honeyby the time he learns to reject the badand choose the good.

16.verse: Before that child has learnedto reject the bad and choose the good,deserted will be the landsof those two kings whom you dread.

17.verse: The Lord will inflict on you,and on your people and your father’s house,days far worse than any that have been seensince Ephraim broke away from Judah—you will become subjects of the king of Assyria.

18.verse: When that day arrives,the Lord will summon flies from the distant streams of Egyptand bees from the land of Assyria.

19.verse: They will all come forth and settlein the steep ravines and in the clefts of the rocks,on all the thornbushes and in all the pastures.

20.verse: On that day the Lord will shavewith a razor hired from across the river(with the king of Assyria)the head and the hair between the legsas well as the beard.

21.verse: When that day comes,each man will keep a young cow and two sheep,

22.verse: and because of the abundant milk they givehe will subsist on curds.For all those who are left in the landwill eat curds and honey.

23.verse: On that day,wherever there used to be a thousand vinesworth a thousand pieces of silver,that area will then be coveredwith brambles and thornbushes.

24.verse: Men will go there with bows and arrows,for the entire country will be coveredby briers and thorns.

25.verse: For fear of briers and thornsyou will not venture upon any hillsthat used to be hoed with a hoe.They will become a place for cattle to grazeand where sheep may tread.

1.verse: Chapter 8 -Isaiah’s Son. -The Lord said to me: Take a large scroll and write on it in ordinary letters: “Maher-shalal-hash-baz.”

2.verse: I had it attested for me by reliable witnesses, Uriah, the priest, and Zechariah, son of Jeberechiah.

3.verse: Then I went to the prophetess, and she conceived and bore a son. The Lord said to me: Name him Maher-shalal-hash-baz,

4.verse: for, before the child knows how to say “father” or “mother,” the wealth of Damascus and the spoils of Samaria will be carried off by the king of Assyria.

5.verse: Once again the Lord spoke to me and said:

6.verse: Because this people has rejectedthe waters of Shiloah that flow gentlyand trembled in fearbefore Rezin and the son of Remaliah,

7.verse: the Lord will therefore raise against itthe mighty flood waters of the river(the king of Assyria and all his glory).The river will rise above all its channelsand overflow all its banks;

8.verse: it will sweep on into Judah like a floodreaching up to the neck,and its wings, spreading out,will cover the breadth of your land, Immanuel.

9.verse: Realize this, you peoples, and be afraid.Listen, all you far-distant nations.Arm yourselves, but be frightened;arm yourselves, but be frightened.

10.verse: No matter what plans you devise,they will come to naught,for God is with us.

11.verse: Isaiah’s Followers. -This is what the Lord said to me when he held me firmly with his hand and warned me not to follow the ways of this people:

12.verse: Do not call conspiracy what this people calls conspiracy,and do not fear what they fearor stand in awe of them.

13.verse: The Lord is the one whom you should proclaim holy;he must be the object of your fear and awe.

14.verse: He will become a snare, an obstacle,a rock over which the two houses of Israel will stumble,a trap and a snare to the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

15.verse: And many of them will stumble;they will fall and be broken;they will be snared and taken captive.

16.verse: Bind up the testimony and seal the teachingso that my disciples can keep it in their hearts.

17.verse: I will wait eagerly for the Lordwho has hidden his face from the house of Jacob;I will place my hope in him.

18.verse: I stand here with the childrenwhom the Lord has given meto be signs and portents in Israelsent by the Lord of hostswho dwells on Mount Zion.

19.verse: People may say to you,“Seek guidance from ghosts and mediumswho whisper and mutter.Should not a people consult its godsand the dead on behalf of the living

20.verse: while seeking instruction or a message?”Those who offer suggestions like thiswill experience no dawn.

21.verse: They will wander through the landgreatly distressed and starving.Once their hunger becomes acute,they will be enragedand curse their king and their gods.They will turn their gaze upward,

22.verse: or downward to the earth,but they will behold only distress and anguish,confusion and the gloom of darkness.

1.verse: Chapter 9 -The Prince of Peace -The people who walked in darknesshave seen a great light;upon those who dwelt in the shadow of deatha light has dawned.

2.verse: You have enlarged the nationand given them great joy;they rejoice before youas those who rejoice at the harvest,as they exult when dividing spoils.

3.verse: For the yoke that burdened them,the bar across their shoulders,and the rod of their oppressoryou have broken as on the day of Midian.

4.verse: For every boot of a warrior that tramped in battleand every garment soaked in bloodwill be burned as fuel for the fire.

5.verse: For a child has been born to us,a son has been given to us.Upon his shoulders dominion rests,and this is the name he has been given:Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God,Eternal Father, Prince of Peace.

6.verse: His dominion will grow continually,and there will be endless peacebestowed on David’s throneand over his kingdom.He will establish and sustain itwith justice and integrityfrom this time onward and forevermore;the zeal of the Lord of hosts will accomplish this.

7.verse: Fall of the Northern Kingdom -The Lord has sent forth his word against Jacob,and it has fallen on Israel.

8.verse: All the people were aware of this,Ephraim and the inhabitants of Samaria,but they said in their arrogance and pride of heart,

9.verse: “The bricks have fallen down,but we will rebuild with dressed stones.The sycamores have been cut down,but we will replace them with cedars.”

10.verse: In response the Lord raised up foes against themand spurred on their enemies,

11.verse: the Arameans on the east and the Philistines on the west,and they devoured Israel with gaping jaws.Yet after all this his anger has not abatedand his hand is still outstretched.

12.verse: But the people did not turn to him who struck them,nor did they seek the Lord of hosts.

13.verse: Therefore, the Lord cut off from Israelhead and tail, palm branch and reed,in a single day.

14.verse: [The elders and the nobles are the head;the prophets who teach lies are the tail.]

15.verse: For those who were leaders of the people led them astray,and those who were led by them were swallowed up.

16.verse: For this reasonthe Lord did not show pity to their young peopleor have compassion on their orphans and widows,since all of them were godless evildoersand every word they spoke was impious.Yet after all this, his anger has not abatedand his hand is still outstretched.

17.verse: For wickedness continued to burn like a fire,consuming briers and thorns,and setting ablaze the thickets of the forestwhich rose upward in a column of smoke.

18.verse: The land was set ablazeby the wrath of the Lord of hosts,and the people became like fuel for the fire;no one spared his brother.

19.verse: They gorged on the right but were still hungry;they devoured on the left but were not satisfied;many ate the flesh of their own offspring.

20.verse: Manasseh devoured Ephraim,and Ephraim devoured Manasseh;together they turned against Judah.

21.verse: Yet after all this, his anger has not abatedand his hand is still outstretched.

1.verse: Chapter 10 -Social Injustice -Woe to those who enact unjust lawsand enforce oppressive statutes,

2.verse: thereby depriving the needy of justice,and making it impossible for the poorest of my peopleto have their rights upheld,as they plunder the widowand make the orphans their prey.

3.verse: What will you do on the day of punishmentwhen disaster befalls you from afar?To whom will you flee for help,and where will you leave your riches,

4.verse: so that you can avoid cowering among the captivesor falling among the slain?Yet after all this, his wrath has not abated;his hand is still outstretched.

5.verse: The Lord Punishes the King of Assyria -Woe to Assyria, the rod of my anger;the club in their hands is my fury.

6.verse: Against a godless people I send him forth,against a nation who aroused my wrath,commanding him to pillage and plunderand to trample on them like mud in the street.

7.verse: But this is not his intention,nor does he have this in mind.His only thought is complete destructionand to liquidate as many nations as possible.

8.verse: For he says,“Are not my commanders all kings?

9.verse: Is not Calno like Carchemish?Is not Hamath like Arpad?Is not Samaria like Damascus?

10.verse: My hand has overcome idolatrous kingdomsthat had more images than Jerusalem and Samaria.

11.verse: As I did to Samaria and her idols,shall I not also do to Jerusalem and her images?”

12.verse: When the Lord has completed all his work on Mount Zion and on Jerusalem, he will punish the king of Assyria for his arrogant boasts and his haughty demeanor,

13.verse: because that king had said,“By my own power I have accomplished all this,and also by my wisdom, for I have great intelligence.I have wiped out the boundaries of nationsand have plundered their treasures;like a giant I have subjugated their inhabitants.

14.verse: My hand has discovered a nestin which the riches of the nation have been stored.And as one gathers eggs that have been abandoned,so I have collected the entire world;not one fluttered a wingor opened a beak to chirp.”

15.verse: Does the ax consider itself more importantthan the man who swings it,or does the saw claim greater creditthan the man who uses it?No sword can control the man who yields it,nor can a club have power over the one who raises it.

16.verse: Therefore, the Lord, the Lord of hosts,will afflict a debilitating illness on his sturdy warriors,and beneath his glory a fever will be kindledlike the burning of fire.

17.verse: The Light of Israel will become a fireand its Holy One a flamethat in a single daywill burn up and consumehis thorns and his briers.

18.verse: His splendid forests and orchardswill be totally destroyed, both body and soul,as when an invalid wastes away.

19.verse: What remains of the trees of the forestwill be so fewthat any young childwill be able to record their number.

20.verse: When that day arrives,the remnant of Israeland the survivors of the house of Jacobwill cease to rely upon the one who struck themand will rather place their trust in the Lord,the Holy One of Israel.

21.verse: A remnant will return, the remnant of Jacob,to the mighty God.

22.verse: Although your people, O Israel,may be as numerous as the sands of the sea,only a remnant of them will return.Destruction has been decreedas righteousness and justice demand.

23.verse: For throughout the entire landthe Lord God of hosts will enforcethe final destruction that has been decreed.

24.verse: Therefore, the Lord God of hosts says this:O my people who dwell in Zion,do not be afraid of the Assyrians,even when they beat you with a rodand raise their staff against youas the Egyptians did.

25.verse: For it will be only a short timeuntil my wrath will subsideand I will direct my anger to their destruction.

26.verse: Then the Lord of hosts will inflict his retributionas he did when he struck Midian at the rock of Oreb,and he will raise his staff over the seaas he did against Egypt.

27.verse: On that dayhis burden will be removed from your shoulderand his yoke will be brokenand fall from your neck.Sennacherib’s Assault -Sennacherib and his army have come up from Rimmon,

28.verse: and they have come to Aiath.They have passed through Migronand stored their supplies at Michmash.

29.verse: Once they crossed the ravine,they camped for the night at Geba.Ramah is terrified,Gibeah of Saul has fled.

30.verse: Cry out loudly, Bath-gallim!Listen carefully, Laishah!Answer her, Anathoth!

31.verse: Madmenah is in flight;the inhabitants of Gebim have sought cover.

32.verse: This day Sennacherib will halt at Noband shake his fistat the mount of daughter Zion,the hill of Jerusalem.

33.verse: Behold, the Lord God of hostswill sever the boughs with frightening power.The tallest trees will be cut downand the lofty ones will be laid low.

34.verse: The thickets of the forest he will demolish with an ax,and Lebanon will fall at the onslaught of the Mighty One.

1.verse: Chapter 11 -A Reign of Justice and Peace -A shoot will spring forth from the stump of Jesse,and a branch will grow from his roots.

2.verse: The Spirit of the Lord will rest upon him:a Spirit of wisdom and understanding,a Spirit of counsel and power,a Spirit of knowledge and fear of the Lord,

3.verse: and his delight will be the fear of the Lord.He will not judge by outward appearancesor reach a verdict based on hearsay.

4.verse: Rather, he will judge the poor with justiceand render fair decisions for the weak and the poor.He will strike the ruthless with the rod of his mouth,and with the breath of his lips he will slay the wicked.

5.verse: Righteousness will be the belt around his waistand faithfulness the belt around his loins.

6.verse: Then the wolf will live alongside the lamb,and the leopard will lie down with the kid;the calf and the young lion will browse together,with a little child to guide them.

7.verse: The cow and the bear will graze side by side;their young will lie down together,and the lion will eat hay like the ox.

8.verse: The infant will play by the cobra’s den,and the young child will lay his handon the viper’s nest.

9.verse: No injury or harm will occuron all my holy mountain;for the earth will be filled with knowledge of the Lordjust as water covers the sea.

10.verse: Ephraim and Judah United -On that day the root of Jessewill be established as a signal to the nations.They will come forth to unite under him,and his dwelling will be glorious.

11.verse: When that day comes,the Lord will reach out his hand a second timeto recover the remnant of his peoplefrom Assyria and Egypt,from Patmos, Ethiopia, and Elam,from Shinar, Hamath, and the islands of the sea.

12.verse: He will raise a signal to the nationsand assemble the outcasts of Israel.He will also gather the dispersed of Judahfrom the four corners of the earth.

13.verse: The jealousy of Ephraim will ceaseand the hostility of Judah will end.Ephraim will not be jealous of Judah,nor will Judah have any hostility toward Ephraim.

14.verse: Together they will swoop downon the foothills of the Philistines to the westand plunder the people of the east.Edom and Moab will become subject to their rule,and the Ammonites will obey them.

15.verse: The Lord will dry up a pathwaythrough the Sea of Egypt,and he will wave his hand over the Euphratesin his fierce anger,splitting it into seven streamsso that it can be crossed on foot.

16.verse: Thus there will be a highwayfor the remnant of his people from Assyria,as there was for the Israeliteswhen they came up from the land of Egypt.

1.verse: Chapter 12 -Thanksgiving for Salvation -On that day you will say:I will give you thanks, O Lord.Even though you were angry with me,your anger has abatedand you have consoled me.

2.verse: God truly is my salvation;I will trust in him and be unafraid.For the Lord is my strength and my source of courage;he has been my salvation.

3.verse: With joy you will draw waterfrom the fountain of salvation,

4.verse: and you will say on that day:Give thanks to the Lord,invoke his name;make known his deeds among the nations;proclaim that his name is exalted.

5.verse: Sing praise to the Lord for his mighty deeds;let this be known throughout the entire world.

6.verse: Cry out and shout for joy,all of you who dwell on Zion,for great in your midstis the Holy One of Israel.

1.verse: Oracles among the Pagan Nations -Chapter 13 -Babylon. -An oracle concerning Babylon that Isaiah, the son of Amoz, received in a vision:

2.verse: Upon a barren hill raise a banner;cry aloud to them.Wave your hand to themto enter the gates of the nobles.

3.verse: I have commanded my consecrated soldiersand summoned my dedicated warriorsto carry out my vengeance.

4.verse: Listen to the great tumult on the mountainslike that of an immense gathering.Listen to the uproar of the kingdoms,of nations assembling;the Lord of hosts is musteringan army for battle.

5.verse: From a distant land,from the end of the heavens,the Lord and the instruments of his wrathare coming to destroy the entire earth.

6.verse: Cry out in anguish,for the day of the Lord is near;it will come like devastation from the Almighty.

7.verse: Therefore, every hand will hang limpand every man’s courage will fade;

8.verse: they will all be panic-stricken,overcome with pangs and agonyand writhing like a woman in labor.They will look aghast at each other,with their faces aflame with fear.

9.verse: Behold, the day of the Lord is coming,a cruel day of wrath and burning anger,to reduce the land to a desert wasteand to destroy all the sinners within it.

10.verse: The stars of the heavens and their constellationswill no longer give forth their light.The sun will be dark when it rises,and the moon will not provide its light.

11.verse: By taking this courseI will punish the world for its wickednessand those who are evil for their iniquity.I will put an end to the pride of the arrogantand humble the insolence of tyrants.

12.verse: I will make human beings more scarce than pure gold,far more rare than the gold of Ophir.

13.verse: Therefore, I am determined to make the heavens trembleand the earth will be shaken to its very foundations,at the wrath of the Lord of hosts,on the day of his blazing anger.

14.verse: Like a gazelle fleeing from a hunter,or like a flock of sheep that no one gathers,everyone will return to his own peopleand flee to his native land.

15.verse: Any who are found will be slaughtered;without exception they will be slain by the sword.

16.verse: Their infants will be smashed to pieces before their eyes;their houses will be plunderedand their wives will be ravished.

17.verse: Behold, I am stirring up against them the Medeswho have no interest in silverand are not tempted by gold.

18.verse: With their bows they will slaughter the young men,and they will show no pity for young children.

19.verse: And Babylon, the most glorious of kingdoms,the splendor and jewel of the Chaldeans,will be like Sodom and Gomorrahwhen they were overthrown by God.

20.verse: It will never be inhabited;no future generations will ever reside there.No Arab will ever again pitch his tent there,nor will shepherds rest their flocks in that land.

21.verse: However, wild animals of the desert will dwell there,and its houses will be filled with jackals.There ostriches will reside,and there wild goats will dance.

22.verse: Hyenas will howl in her castlesand jackals in her luxurious palaces.Her time draws near,and her days will not be prolonged.

1.verse: Chapter 14 -Taunting the King of Babylon. -The Lord will have compassion on Jacob, and he will once again choose Israel. He will resettle them on their native soil, where foreigners will join them and attach themselves to the house of Jacob.

2.verse: Nations will take them and escort them to their homeland, and the house of Israel will accept them as male and female slaves in the Lord’s land. The house of Israel will also enslave those who had enslaved them and will rule her oppressors.

3.verse: When that day arrives that the Lord affords you relief from your suffering and trouble and from the cruel servitude that had been imposed upon you,

4.verse: you will take up this taunt-song against the king of Babylon:Behold how the oppressor has come to an end!Behold how his arrogance has ceased!

5.verse: The Lord has broken the rod of the wicked,the scepter of rulers,

6.verse: that struck down the peoples in wrath,inflicting continuous blows,and that furiously crushed the nationswith relentless persecution.

7.verse: The entire world is at rest and peaceful;shouts of joy resound.

8.verse: The cypresses exult over you,as do the cedars of Lebanon, saying,“Now that you have been laid low,no one approaches to cut us down.”

9.verse: The netherworld below is all astirto greet you upon your arrival.To welcome you it aroused the departed spirits,all the rulers of the earth.It raised from their thronesall those who were kings of the nations.

10.verse: All of them will speak outand greet you with these words,“You too have become as weak as we are.You have become like us.”

11.verse: Your pomp has descended to the netherworldalong with the music of your harps.Maggots compose the mattress upon which you lie,and worms serve as your blanket.

12.verse: To what depths have you fallen from the heavens,O morning star, son of the dawn!How you have been cut down to the ground,you who laid the nations low!

13.verse: You used to say in your heart,“I will scale the heavens.I will raise my throneabove the stars of God.I will sit on the Mountain of Assembly,in the far recesses of the north.

14.verse: I will ascend above the highest clouds;I will be like the Most High.”

15.verse: Instead you have been hurled down to the netherworld,to the depths of the abyss.

16.verse: Those who see you will stare at you,and as they do so they will wonder,“Is this the man who made the earth trembleand overthrew kingdoms,

17.verse: who turned the world into a desert,laid its cities in ruins,and refused to let his prisoners return home?”

18.verse: All the kings of the nations lie in honor,each one in his own tomb.

19.verse: But you have been cast out without burial,like some loathsome piece of flesh;you are covered with the dead,with those pierced by the swordwho descend to the rocks of the abyss.

20.verse: You will never be buried with those kingsbecause you have destroyed your landand brought death to your people.The offspring of the wickedwill never again be mentioned.

21.verse: Make ready to slaughter his sonsbecause of the guilt of their father.Let them never again rise to possess the earthand cover the face of the earth with their cities.

22.verse: I will rise up against them, says the Lord of hosts, and I will deprive Babylon of her name and remnant, her offspring and posterity, says the Lord.

23.verse: I will cause it to become a haunt of the hedgehogs and a marshland; I will sweep it with the broom of destruction, says the Lord of hosts.

24.verse: Assyria -The Lord of hosts has sworn:As I have resolved, so will it be;as I have planned, so will it come to pass.

25.verse: I will break the Assyrian in my landand trample him underfoot on my mountains;his yoke will be lifted from my people,and his burden will be removed from their shoulders.

26.verse: This is the plan that the Lord has preparedfor the entire world,and this is the hand that he has outstretchedover all the nations.

27.verse: For the Lord of hosts has devised this plan;who can thwart it?His hand is outstretched;who can turn it back?

28.verse: Philistia. -In the year that King Ahaz died, this oracle was proclaimed:

29.verse: Let not a single one of you rejoice, O Philistia,that the rod that struck you is broken.For from the root of a snake will be born a viper,and its fruit will be a flying serpent.

30.verse: The poor of my people will eat in my pasture,and the destitute will lie down in safety.But I will make your offspring die of hunger,and I will then slay the remnant.

31.verse: Howl, O gate! Cry out, O city!Let all Philistia be stricken with fear!For a mighty foe is coming from the north,without a single straggler in its ranks.

32.verse: What reply will then be givento the envoys of that nation?“The Lord has established Zion,and the afflicted of his peoplewill find refuge in her.”

1.verse: Chapter 15 -Moab -An oracle concerning Moab:Having been laid waste in a single night,Ar of Moab is destroyed.Having been laid waste in a single night,Kir of Moab is destroyed.

2.verse: The daughter of Dibon goes upto the high places to weep.Moab wails unceasinglyover Nebo and Medeba.Every head has been shaved,every beard has been cut off.

3.verse: In the streets they wear sackcloth;on the roofs and in the public squareseveryone wails and collapses in tears.

4.verse: Hesbon and Elealeh cry out in distress;their voices are heard as far away as Jahaz.As a result, the bravest of Moab’s warriors cry outand their hearts grow faint.

5.verse: My heart cries out for Moab;her fugitives have arrived close to Zoar,at Eglath-shelishiyah.They climb the slope of Luhith,weeping as they make their ascent;on the road to Horonaimthey emit heart-rending cries.

6.verse: The waters of Nimrimhave become a desolate waste.The grass is parched,the plants have withered away,and nothing green can be seen.

7.verse: Therefore, the people carry awayacross the Ravine of the Willowswhatever possessions they can manageand the savings they have accumulated.

8.verse: Their cry of distress has echoedaround the land of Moab.Their wailing reaches as far as Eglaim;it can be heard even to the land of Beer-elim.

9.verse: The waters of Dimon are filled with blood,but I have far worse in store for Dimon:a lion for those who are fleeing from Moab,as well as for those who are left on its soil.

1.verse: Chapter 16 -Send forth lambs to the ruler of the land,from Sela across the desertto the mount of daughter Zion.

2.verse: Like fluttering birds,like scattered nestlings,are the women of Moabat the fords of the Arnon.

3.verse: Offer your counsel,grant us your justice.At high noonlet your shadow be like night.Hide those who are outcastsand do not betray the fugitives.

4.verse: Allow the outcasts of Moabto settle among you,and be their refuge from the destroyer.When the oppression has ceasedand the devastation is at an end,and the marauders who have trampled the landhave finally departed,

5.verse: a throne established in faithful lovewill be established in the tent of David,and on it will sit in fidelitya judge who offers fair judgmentand is prompt to ensure justice.

6.verse: We have heard about the pride of Moab,about how truly intense that pride is,with its arrogance, its pride, and its insolence,as well as its boasts which have little basis.

7.verse: Therefore, let Moab wail,every one of its inhabitants.In their grief they will longfor the raisin cakes of Kir-hareseth.

8.verse: The vineyards of Heshbon have withered,the vines of Sibmah.The lords of the nationshave destroyed the choicest vinesthat once reached as far as Jazerand spread out toward the desert,and whose shoots with their spreading branchesspread across the sea.

9.verse: Therefore, I weep with Jazerfor the vines of Sibmah.I drench you with tears,Heshbon and Elealeh,for the cries of battle have fallenover your harvest and vintage.

10.verse: Joy and gladnesshave been taken away from the fields.In the vineyards no songs are sung,no joyful shouts are raised.No one treads out wine in the wine-pressesno cheers of happiness are heard.

11.verse: That is the reason whymy heart throbs like a harp for Moaband my soul for Kir-hareseth.

12.verse: When the Moabites approachand exhaust themselves on the high places,they will flock to their sanctuaries to pray,but it will avail them nothing.

13.verse: This was the word that the Lord spoke about Moab in the past.

14.verse: But now the Lord says: In three years, as a hired worker reckons them, the glory of Moab will be regarded with contempt, despite its vast multitude. The remnant that survive will be few in number and very feeble.

1.verse: Chapter 17 -Damascus -An oracle concerning Damascus:Before long Damascus will cease to be a city,and she will be reduced to a heap of ruins.

2.verse: Her towns will be abandoned forever;they will serve as pastures for flockswho will lie there undisturbed.

3.verse: No longer will Ephraim have a fortressor Damascus a kingdom.The glory of the remnant of Aramwill be like that of the children of Israel,says the Lord of hosts.

4.verse: On that daythe glory of Jacob will grow dimand the flesh of his body will grow lean,

5.verse: as when the reaper gathers the standing grain,harvesting the ears with his arms,or as when one gleans the ears of grainin the Valley of Rephaim.

6.verse: Nothing will remain except the scattered remnant,as when an olive tree is beaten:two or three olives on the highest bough,four or five on each of its fruitful branches,says the Lord, the God of Israel.

7.verse: On that day,men will look to their Creator,and they will turn their eyesto the Holy One of Israel.

8.verse: They will not gaze upon the altars, their handiwork,nor shall they regard what their fingers have madethe sacred poles and the altars of incense.

9.verse: On that day their strong cities will belike those abandoned by the Hivites and the Amoriteswhich they deserted because of the Israelites’ advance;their cities will be left desolate.

10.verse: You have forgotten the God of your salvationand have not kept in mind the Rock, your refuge.Therefore, you plant your pagan gardensand sow exotic seeds for a foreign god.

11.verse: Even though you cause them to sprouton the day that you plant them,and make them sprout blossomson the following morning,yet the harvest will disappearwhen struck by a wasting disease and incurable blight.

12.verse: Listen to the thunder of vast hordes,its volume like that of the roaring sea.Listen to the roar of nations,its volume like that of mighty waves.

13.verse: But when God rebukes themthey flee far away,driven like chaff on the mountains before the windand like whirling dust before the storm.

14.verse: In the evening terror has spread,but by the morning it has disappeared.Such is the fate of those who plunder us,the lot of those who despoil us.

1.verse: Chapter 18 -Ethiopia -Woe to the land of buzzing locustsbeyond the rivers of Ethiopia,

2.verse: sending ambassadors by seain papyrus vessels across the waters.Go forth, you swift messengers,to a nation tall and bronzed,to a people dreaded near and far,a mighty and conquering nationwhose land is crossed by many rivers.

3.verse: All you who inhabit the world,you who dwell on the earth,you will see when the signal is raised on the mountainsand hear when the trumpet is sounded.

4.verse: For this is what the Lord said to me:I will quietly look down from my dwellinglike the shimmering heat of the summer sun,like a cloud of dew during the harvest heat.

5.verse: For prior to the harvest, when the flowering is overand the blooms become ripening grapesthe shoots will be cut off with pruning hooks,and the branches will be cut away and discarded.

6.verse: They will all be leftto the birds of prey on the mountainsand to the wild beasts of the earth.In summer the birds of prey will dwell there,while the wild animals will winter on them.

7.verse: At that time offerings will be brought to the Lord of hosts from a tall and bronzed people dreaded near and far, a mighty and conquering nation whose land is crisscrossed by rivers, to Mount Zion, the place where the name of the Lord of hosts dwells.

1.verse: Chapter 19 -Egypt -An oracle concerning Egypt:Behold, the Lord is riding on a swift cloud,and he is coming to Egypt.The idols of Egypt will tremble before him,and the hearts of the Egyptians will melt within them.

2.verse: I will stir up Egyptians against Egyptians,and they will fight against one another,brother against brother, neighbor against neighbor,city against city, kingdom against kingdom.

3.verse: The spirit of the Egyptians will ebb away within them,and I will throw their deliberations into disarray.They will then resort to consulting idolsand the spirits of the dead,as well as ghosts and sorcerers.

4.verse: I will deliver the Egyptiansinto the power of a harsh master,a cruel king who will rule over them—says the Lord, the Lord of hosts.

5.verse: The waters of the Nile will ebb away,and the river will become parched and dry.

6.verse: Its canals will emit a terrible stench,and its branches will diminish and dry up;reeds and rushes will wither away.

7.verse: All the plants on the banks of the Nileand all the vegetation of the Nilewill dry up, blow away, and vanish.

8.verse: The fishermen will groan and mourn,all those who cast their hooks into the Nile,while those who spread their nets on the waterwill lose heart.

9.verse: The linen-workers will despair,as will the combers and weavers.

10.verse: The spinners will be dismayed,and all who work for wages will be crushed.

11.verse: The princes of Zoan are utter fools;the wisest of Pharaoh’s counselors offer stupid advice.How can you dare to say to Pharaoh,“I am descended from sages;I spring from ancient kings”?

12.verse: Where then are your sages?Let them tell you,so that all may knowwhat the Lord of hosts has planned against Egypt.

13.verse: The princes of Zoan have become fools.and the princes of Memphis have been deceived.The chiefs of her tribeshave led Egypt astray.

14.verse: The Lord has infused themwith a spirit of confusion;they have made Egypt stagger in everything she does,just as a drunkard staggers around in his vomit.

15.verse: Neither head nor tail,neither palm branch nor reed,will be able to do anything for Egypt.

16.verse: On that day the Egyptians will be like women, trembling with fear because the Lord of hosts has raised his hand against them.

17.verse: And the land of Judah will become a source of terror to the Egyptians. Every time they remember Judah, they will tremble with fear because of the plan that the Lord of hosts has devised against them.

18.verse: On that day there will be five cities in the land of Egypt speaking the language of Canaan and swearing allegiance to the Lord of hosts. One of these will be called the City of the Sun.

19.verse: On that day there will be an altar to the Lord in the land of Egypt, and a sacred pillar to the Lord at its border.

20.verse: It will serve as a sign and a witness to the Lord of hosts in the land of Egypt. When they cry out to the Lord for his help against their oppressors, he will send them a savior to defend and deliver them.

21.verse: The Lord will make himself known to the Egyptians, and the Egyptians will acknowledge the Lord on that day. They will offer sacrifices and oblations, and they will make vows to the Lord and fulfill them.

22.verse: The Lord will strike Egypt severely, but he will then bring them healing. After that they will return to the Lord, and he will listen to their prayers and heal them.

23.verse: On that day there will be a highway from Egypt to Assyria. The Assyrians will enter Egypt, and the Egyptians will enter Assyria, and Egyptians and Assyrians will worship together.

24.verse: On that day Israel will be a member of a triumvirate with Egypt and Assyria, a blessing at the center of the world,

25.verse: and the Lord of hosts will bless them with these words: “Blessed be my people Egypt, and Assyria the work of my hands, and Israel my heritage.”

1.verse: Chapter 20 -The Fate of Egypt and Ethiopia. -In the year that the commander-in-chief, who had been sent by King Sargon of Assyria, came to Ashdod, he fought against it and captured it.

2.verse: At that time the Lord spoke to Isaiah, the son of Amoz, and issued this warning, “Go forth, take off the sackcloth from your waist, and remove the sandals from your feet.” Isaiah did as he had been instructed, walking naked and barefoot.

3.verse: Then the Lord said, “Just as my servant Isaiah has gone naked and barefoot for three years as a sign and portent against Egypt and Ethiopia,

4.verse: so shall the king of Assyria lead away the captives of Egypt and the exiles from Ethiopia, both the young and the aged, naked and barefoot, with their buttocks exposed, to the shame of Egypt.

5.verse: Then they will be dismayed and ashamed of Ethiopia their hope and of Egypt their boast.

6.verse: On that day the inhabitants of the coastland will say, ‘Observe what has happened to those in whom we hoped and to whom we fled for help and deliverance from the king of Assyria. How will we now be able to escape?’ ”

1.verse: Chapter 21 -The Defeat of Babylon -An oracle concerning the wilderness of the sea:Like whirlwinds sweeping over the Negeb,there comes from the desert,from a land that inspires terror,

2.verse: a harsh vision that is shown to me:the traitor betraysand the despoiler despoils.Go forth, O Elam;lay siege, O Media.I will bring to an endall the pain she has inflicted.

3.verse: Therefore, my loins are filled with anguish;pangs have seized melike those of a woman in labor.I am so distraught that I cannot hear;I am too frightened even to look.

4.verse: My mind reels,and I am overcome with dread;the twilight I yearned forhas become horrifying to me.

5.verse: They set the table;they spread out the rugs;they eat and they drink.Rise up, O princes;oil your shields.

6.verse: For this is what the Lord has said to me:Go forth and post a lookout;let him report what he sees.

7.verse: If he should see cavalry,horsemen riding in pairs,men mounted on donkeys,men mounted on camels,instruct him to watch closelyand to listen diligently.

8.verse: Then the lookout shouted,“I stand on the watchtower, O Lord,all day long,and I remain stationed at my postthroughout the night.

9.verse: Behold, here come the cavalry now,horsemen riding in pairs.”Then the Lord responded:Fallen, fallen is Babylon,and all the images of her godshave been smashed to the ground.

10.verse: O my people,you who have been troddenupon the threshing floor,what I have heard from the Lord of hosts,from the God of Israel,I have proclaimed to you.

11.verse: Edom -An oracle concerning Edom:Someone is calling to me from Seir,“Watchman, when will the night end?Watchman, when will it end?”

12.verse: The watchman replies,“Morning will come, and so will the night.If you wish to ask, do so;come back again.”

13.verse: Arabia -An oracle concerning Arabia:In the thickets of the desert you will encamp,you caravans of Dedanites.

14.verse: Bring water to the thirstyand greet the fugitives with bread,you inhabitants of the land of Tema.

15.verse: For they have fled from the sword,from the sharp edge of the drawn sword,from the bent bow,and from the stress of battles.

16.verse: For these are the words spoken to me by the Lord: Within a year, as a hired worker reckons time, all the glory of Kedar will come to an end.

17.verse: Hardly any of Kedar’s valiant warriors will be left, for the Lord, the God of Israel, has spoken.

1.verse: Chapter 22 -Jerusalem -An oracle concerning the Valley of Vision:What possible reason can there befor all of you to have gone up on the housetops,

2.verse: dwellers in a city full of commotion,a city exultant and filled with tumult?Your slain did not fall by the sword,nor did they perish in battle.

3.verse: All your leaders fled away together,only to be capturedwithout a weapon to defend themselves.All of them who were found were capturedeven though they had fled in all directions.

4.verse: That is the reason why I said:Turn your eyes away from me;let me weep bitterly.Do not try to console meabout the destruction of my people.

5.verse: For this is a day ordained by the Lord of hosts,a day of rout, tumult, and confusionin the Valley of Vision,a day on which walls will be battered downand cries for help echo through the mountains.

6.verse: Elam has taken up his quiver,the chariots of Aram have their horses prepared,and Kir has bared his shield.

7.verse: Your fairest valleys are filled with chariots,and the cavalry stands ready at the gates;

8.verse: the Lord has removed his sheltering hand from Judah.On that day you checked out the supply of weapons in the House of the Forest.

9.verse: You observed that there were many breaches in the City of David, and you collected the waters of the lower pool.

10.verse: You counted the buildings in Jerusalem, and you tore down some to strengthen the wall.

11.verse: Between the two walls you constructed a reservoir for the water of the old pool. But you did not look to the city’s Maker or give a thought to him who built it long ago.

12.verse: On that day the Lord,the Lord of hosts,called on you to eat and mourn,to shave your head and put on sackcloth.

13.verse: But instead you indulged in joy and merriment,the killing of oxen and the slaughtering of sheep,the eating of meat and the drinking of wine,saying, “Let us eat and drink,for tomorrow we die.”

14.verse: Then the Lord of hosts revealed this to me:This wickedness will not be forgiven youuntil you die,says the Lord God of hosts.

15.verse: Shebna and Eliakim -Thus says the Lord God of hosts:Go forth and find that official,Shebna, the master of the palace, and say:

16.verse: What are you doing here,and who gave you permissionto hew a tomb for yourself here?By what right have you hewn your grave on a heightand chiseled out your tomb in the rock?

17.verse: The Lord is about to hurl you away violently;he will grasp you firmly

18.verse: and roll you up and throw you like a ballinto a vast expanse.There you will die,and there your splendid chariots will lie;you are a disgrace to your master’s household.

19.verse: I will remove you from your office,and you will be pulled down from your post.

20.verse: On that day I will summonmy servant Eliakim, the son of Hilkiah.

21.verse: I will clothe him with your robeand place your sash around his waist,and I will bestow upon him your authority.He will be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalemand to the house of Judah.

22.verse: I will place on his shoulderthe key of the house of David.When he opens,no one will close;when he closes,no one will open.

23.verse: I will fasten him like a peg in a secure place,and he will become a throne of honor for his family.

24.verse: Upon him will depend all the glory of his family,his descendants, and his offspring,and even the smallest vessels, from cups to pitchers.

25.verse: On that day, says the Lord of hosts,the peg that was securely fastenedwill give way, break loose, and fall,and whatever had been hanging on it will be lost.For the Lord has spoken.

1.verse: Chapter 23 -Tyre and Sidon -An oracle concerning Tyre:Wail, O ships of Tarshish,for your harbor has been destroyed.From the land of Cyprusthe news has reached them.

2.verse: Be silent, you who dwell along the coast,you merchants of Sidon,whose messengers crossed over the sea

3.verse: to the vast ocean.The grain of Shihor, the harvest of the Nileprovided your revenue;you were the merchant for the nations.

4.verse: Be ashamed, O Sidon, the fortress of the sea,for the sea has declared:“I have not endured the anguish of labor,nor have I given birth;I have not reared young menor brought up young women.”

5.verse: When the news reaches Egypt,they will writhe in anguishupon hearing the fate of Tyre.

6.verse: Cross over to Tarshish;wail, you inhabitants of the coast.

7.verse: Is this your vibrant cityfounded in the days of old,and whose feet have led her awayto settle in distant lands?

8.verse: Who has devised this planagainst Tyre, the bestower of crowns,whose merchants were princesand whose traders were held in the highest esteemthroughout the earth?

9.verse: The Lord of hosts has devised this planto deflate the glory of the proudand to humiliate the honored men of the earth.

10.verse: Cross over to your own land,you ships of Tarshish,for your harbors no longer exist.

11.verse: The Lord has stretched out his hand over the seaand brought kingdoms to their knees;he has commanded the destructionof the fortresses of Canaan.

12.verse: He has said:You will exult no more,O greatly oppressed virgin daughter of Sidon.Arise and cross over to Cyprus,but even there you will find no rest.

13.verse: Look at the land of the Chaldeans;it was this people, not Assyria,who erected siege-towers,tore down its palaces,and left it in ruins.

14.verse: Cry out in anguish, O ships of Tarshish,for your fortress has been destroyed.

15.verse: From that day, Tyre will be forgotten for seventy years, the span of one king’s life. At the end of those seventy years, the plight of Tyre will be identical to that of the prostitute in the song:

16.verse: Take your harpand walk throughout the city,you long-forgotten prostitute.Pluck your strings sweetlyand sing many songsso that they may remember you.

17.verse: At the end of the seventy years the Lord will visit Tyre. She will once again ply her trade and prostitute herself with all the kingdoms of the world on the face of the earth.

18.verse: But her merchandise and her profits will be dedicated to the Lord; they will not be stored up or hoarded, but they will provide abundant food and clothing to those who live in the presence of the Lord.

1.verse: Apocalypse of Isaiah -Chapter 24 -Universal Judgment: A Grateful Remnant -Behold how the Lord is preparingto lay waste the earth;he will turn it into a desertand scatter its inhabitants,

2.verse: with the same fate afflicting both priest and people,slave and master,maid and mistress,seller and buyer,lender and borrower,creditor and debtor.

3.verse: The earth will be totally ravagedand completely despoiled;this has the Lord decreed.

4.verse: The earth mourns and fades away;the world languishes and withers;the exalted of the earth are brought low.

5.verse: The earth is defiledby those who dwell in it;for they have transgressed laws,violated statutes,and broken the everlasting covenant.

6.verse: Therefore, a curse has consumed the earth,and its inhabitants pay the penalty of their guilt;as a result, the number of its inhabitants dwindles,and only a few survive.

7.verse: The new wine dries upand the vine withers awayas the revelers groan in their sorrow.

8.verse: The cheerful sound of tambourines is stilled;the shouts of the revelers fade away;the lyre’s joyful melodies are no longer heard.

9.verse: The people drink wine but without any singing;strong liquor tastes bitter to those who consume it.

10.verse: The city is shattered and in a state of chaos;every house has its entrance barred.

11.verse: In the streets the people cry out for wine;no joy can be observed;happiness seems to have been banished from the land.

12.verse: Only desolation remains in the city;its gates have been smashed so badlythat they are beyond hope of repair.

13.verse: This condition will hold trueamong all the nations throughout the world;as happens to an olive tree after it is beatenor to the gleanings that remainafter the grape harvest.

14.verse: The people raise their voices in joyful praise,proclaiming from the west the majesty of the Lord,

15.verse: “Let the Lord be glorified in the east;in the coastlands of the seaglorify the name of the Lord,the God of Israel.”

16.verse: From the ends of the earth we hear songsthat praise the glory of the Righteous One.But I said, “I am wasting away.I am wasting away. Woe is me!For the traitors continue to betray;the traitors have acted with great treachery.

17.verse: Terror and the pit and the snarethreaten all of you inhabitants of the earth.

18.verse: Anyone who flees from the sound of terrorwill fall into the pit,and whoever climbs out of the pitwill be caught in the snare.For the windows of heaven will be openedand the foundations of the earth will shake.

19.verse: The earth will be totally shattered,the earth will be torn apartthe earth will be violently convulsed.

20.verse: The earth will stagger like a drunkardand sway like a fragile hut;its transgressions will weigh heavily upon it,and it will fall, never to rise again.”

21.verse: On that day the Lord will punishin the heavens the host of the heavens,and on the earth the kings of the earth.

22.verse: They will be herded together,jammed in like prisoners in a dungeon.They will be shut up in a pitand punished after many years.

23.verse: Then the moon will seem to fade awayand the sun will hide in shame.For the Lord of hosts will reignon Mount Zion and in Jerusalem,and he will manifest his gloryto the elders of his people.

1.verse: Chapter 25 -O Lord, you are my God.I will exalt you and praise your name,for you have accomplished wonderful things,formulated in ages past, faithful and sure.

2.verse: You have made the city a heap of ruins,the fortified city a mass of rubble.The citadel of foreigners is a city no more,and it will never be rebuilt.

3.verse: Therefore, mighty peoples will honor you,and the cities of ruthless nationswill regard you with awe.

4.verse: For you have been a refuge for the poor,a refuge to the needy in their distress,a shelter from the stormand a shade from the heat.

5.verse: The blast of the ruthlessis like a winter storm or a scorching drought,but you subdue the roar of the foe,and the song of the ruthless fades away.

6.verse: On this mountain the Lord of hostswill prepare for all peoplesa feast of rich food and vintage wines,of succulent foods and well-aged wines.

7.verse: On this mountain the Lord will destroythe veil that shrouds all the peoples,the path spread over all the nations;

8.verse: he will destroy death forever.Then the Lord God will wipe awaythe tears from every face,and from the entire earth he will removethe shame of all his people;for the Lord has spoken.

9.verse: It will be said on that day,“Behold, this is our God;in him we place our hope for deliverance.This is the Lord for whom we have waited;let us rejoice and be glad that he has saved us.”

10.verse: For the hand of the Lord will not rest on this mountain,but Moab will be trodden under his feetas straw is trodden into the dung-heap.

11.verse: The Lord will stretch forth his hands in Moabas a swimmer stretches out his hands to swim,and he will humble their prideas his hands sweep over them.

12.verse: He will overthrow the high fortifications of their walls,casting them down to the groundand making them level with the dust.

1.verse: Chapter 26 -A Song of Victory. -On that day this song will be sung in the land of Judah:We have a strongly fortified city,with walls and ramparts established to protect us.

2.verse: Open the gatesto allow the upright nation to enter,the nation that keeps faith.

3.verse: O Lord, you grant peace to those who are steadfastbecause of their trust in you.

4.verse: Trust in the Lord forever,for the Lord is an eternal rock.

5.verse: He has brought low those in high placesand leveled their citadel,casting it down to the groundand flinging it down to the dust,

6.verse: to be trampled underfootby the feet of the poor and the oppressed.

7.verse: The path of the righteous is smooth,for you make level the way of the just.

8.verse: As we proceed in the path of your judgments,we wait for you, O Lord;your name and your renownare all that our heart desires.

9.verse: My soul longs for you throughout the night,and my spirit within me seeks your presence.For when your judgments are revealed to the earth,the inhabitants of the world learn to practice justice.

10.verse: If favor is granted to the wicked,they will never learn justice.In the presence of the upright they will act perverselyand fail to behold the majesty of the Lord.

11.verse: O Lord, your hand is raised highbut they fail to see it.Let them be ashamedwhen they behold your zeal for your people;let the fire reserved for your enemies consume them.

12.verse: O Lord, you will grant us peace;everything we have accomplished you have done for us.

13.verse: O Lord, our God,other lords besides you have ruled us,but we acknowledge only your name.

14.verse: The dead will not come back to life;their departed spirits will not rise again.For you have punished and destroyed themand eradicated all memory of them.

15.verse: O Lord, you have enlarged the nation,and in enlarging it you have been glorified;you have extended all the frontiers of the country.

16.verse: O Lord, in our distress we cried out to you,pouring forth our prayersas we suffered your chastisement.

17.verse: As a woman who is pregnantwrithes and cries out in her agonywhen her time of delivery is near,so were we because of you, O Lord.

18.verse: We were with child and writhed with pain,but we gave birth only to wind.We have achieved no salvation for the earth,and no one has been born to inhabit the world.

19.verse: But your dead will liveand their bodies will rise again.Awake and sing for joy,you who sleep in the dust.For your dew will be radiant,and the earth will give birth againto those who have long been dead.

20.verse: The Lord’s Vindication -Go forth, my people, enter your chambers,and shut your doors behind you.Withdraw for a short whileuntil the wrath has subsided.

21.verse: For the Lord emerges from his dwelling placeto punish the inhabitants of the earthfor their wickedness.The earth will reveal the blood shed upon itand will no longer hide its slain.

1.verse: Chapter 27 -On that day,the Lord will use his swordthat is cruel and great and strongto punish Leviathan the fleeing serpent,Leviathan the writhing serpent,and he will slay that dragonthat resides in the sea.

2.verse: On that day,sing of the pleasant vineyard.

3.verse: I, the Lord, am its keeper,and I water it frequentlylest any harm come to it;I guard it night and day.

4.verse: I do not quickly succumb to anger,but if I were to find briars and thorns,I would march against them in battleand consume them in fire.

5.verse: However, if they decide to ask for my protection,let them make their peace with me;otherwise I cannot protect them.

6.verse: In days to come,Jacob will take root,Israel will bud and blossom,and the entire world will be covered with fruit.

7.verse: Has the Lord struck them downas he struck down those who struck him?Has he slaughtered themas their attackers were slaughtered?

8.verse: By expelling and exiling themhe has taken action against them,removing them with a breathas fierce as the east wind.

9.verse: In this way will the guilt of Jacob be expiatedand the full fruit of renouncing his sin will occur,when he crushes all the altar stones to pieceslike lumps of chalk,and no sacred poles and incense altarswill remain standing.

10.verse: For the fortified city will be abandoned,a deserted pasture, a forsaken wilderness;the calves will graze and lie down there,destroying its branches.

11.verse: When its boughs grow dry and snap off,women will come and use them for firewood.For this is a people that lacks understanding;therefore their Maker will not have compassion for them;he who formed them will not show mercy toward them.

12.verse: On that day,the Lord will thresh the grainfrom the streams of the Euphratesto the Wadi of Egypt,and you will be gathered one by one,O people of Egypt.

13.verse: On that day,a great trumpet will be sounded,and those who were lost in the land of Assyriaand those who were outcasts in the land of Egyptwill come to worship the Lordon the holy mountain in Jerusalem.

1.verse: The Lord Saves Israel and Judah -Chapter 28 -Against Samaria -Woe to the proud garlands of Ephraim’s drunkardsand to the fading flowers of its glorious beauty,the crowning glory of a nation of menovercome with wine and lying in the streets.

2.verse: But behold, the Lord has one in his servicewho is mighty and strong,and who, like a storm of hail,like a destroying tempest,like a torrent of rain and raging flood waters,will hurl them violently to the ground.

3.verse: The majestic garlands of Ephraim’s drunkardswill be trampled underfoot.

4.verse: And the fading blooms of its glorious beauty,at the head of the lush valley,will be like early figs before the summer;whoever sees them will pluck themand immediately consume them.

5.verse: On that day the Lord of hostswill be a crown of gloryand a beautiful diademto the remnant of his people,

6.verse: a spirit of justiceto the one who sits in judgment,and a spirit of strength to thosewho repel the enemy at the city gates.

7.verse: Against Judah -These also stagger from wineand stumble due to strong drink.Priests and prophets are confused because of liquor;alcohol leaves them unable to think clearlyor to pronounce fair judgments.

8.verse: Every table is covered with filthy vomit;no place is clean.

9.verse: “To whom will the prophet impart knowledge?To whom will he explain his message?To babies who are newly weaned,to those just taken from the breast?

10.verse: With him we are givencommand after command, command after command,rule after rule, rule after rule,here a little, there a little.”

11.verse: Now, with stammering lipsand in an alien tongue,he will speak to this people,

12.verse: to whom he has said,“This is the place for rest;give rest to the weary.This is the place for repose.”However, they would not listen.

13.verse: Therefore, to them the word of the Lord will be,“Command after command, command after command,rule after rule, rule after rule,here a little, there a little.”

14.verse: Therefore, listen to the word of the Lord,you arrogant rulers of this people in Jerusalem.

15.verse: Proudly you have boasted,“We have made a covenant with deathand entered into a pact with the netherworld.And so, when the overwhelming scourge occurs,it will not afflict us.For we have made lies our refugeand taken shelter in falsehood.”

16.verse: Therefore, the Lord Godhas this to say to you in response:Behold, I am laying a stone in Zion,a stone that has been tested,a precious cornerstone as a firm foundation;those who place their trust in it will not falter.

17.verse: And I will make justice the measuring line,with righteousness as the plumb line.Hail will sweep away the refuge of lies,and flood waters will submerge your hiding place.

18.verse: Then your covenant with death will be annulledand your pact with Sheol will not survive.When the raging waters roar forth,you will be overwhelmed by them.

19.verse: As often as the flood sweeps through,it will engulf you,sweeping over you day and night,as terror conveys the message clearly.

20.verse: For your bed will be too shortto enable you to stretch out,and the blanket will be too narrowto cover you sufficiently.

21.verse: Then the Lord will rise up as on Mount Perazim,and he will rage as he did in the Valley of Gibeon,to accomplish his work, his mysterious work,and to perform his deed, his strange deed.

22.verse: Therefore, cease your arrogance,or your bonds will be further tightened.For the Lord God of hosts has revealed to methe destruction he has decreed for the entire earth.

23.verse: Listen carefully to my words;pay close attention to what I have to say.

24.verse: Does the plowman spend his entire time plowing,breaking up and harrowing his land?

25.verse: Once he has leveled its surface,does he not scatter the fennel and sow cummin,and plant wheat and barley,with spelt around the borders?

26.verse: God has instructed him in thisand trained him correctly.

27.verse: Fennel must not be threshed with a sledge,nor is a cartwheel rolled over cummin.

28.verse: Grain must be crushed for bread,but it cannot be done so to excess;one maneuvers the cartwheels and the horsesbut is careful not to grind it too fine.
