29.verse: All this knowledge comes from the Lord of hostswhose counsel is wonderfuland whose wisdom is great.

1.verse: Chapter 29 -The Siege of Jerusalem -Woe to Ariel, Ariel,the city where David encamped.Year after year will pass,and the festivals will be celebrated annually.

2.verse: Yet I will inflict distress upon Ariel,and there will be endless mourning and lamentationas she becomes like an altar of fire.

3.verse: I will encamp against you like David,completely surround you with my forcesand erect siege-works against you.

4.verse: Then, as you lie prostrate, you will speak,and from the dust of the earthyour words will come forth.Your voice will rise from the groundlike that of a ghost,and your words will whisper out of the dust.

5.verse: But the vast throng of your enemieswill be like fine dust,and the horde of your ruthless foeswill be like flying chaff.Then suddenly, in an instant,

6.verse: you will be visited by the Lord of hosts,accompanied by thunder and earthquake and intense din,by whirlwind and tempestand the flame of devouring fire.

7.verse: Then the horde of all the nationsthat fight against Ariel,all who fight against her,besieging her and causing her great anguish,will fade away like a dream,like a vision in the night.

8.verse: Just as when a hungry man dreams of eatingand then awakens with an empty stomach,or as when a thirsty man dreams of drinkingand then awakens to find his throat still parched,so will it be with the horde of all the nationsthat make war against Mount Zion.

9.verse: Hypocrisy and Deception -If you stupefy yourselves,you will remain in a stupor.If you blind yourselves,you will remain blind.Be drunk, but not on wine;stagger, but not from strong drink.

10.verse: For the Lord has poured out on youa spirit of deep sleep;he has closed your eyes, you prophets,and covered your heads, you seers.

11.verse: The prophetic vision of all this has become like the words of a sealed scroll. If you hand it to someone who is able to read and you say to him, “Please read this,” he will answer, “I cannot, because it is sealed.”

12.verse: And if you hand it to someone who cannot read and say to him, “Please read this,” he will reply, “I cannot read.”

13.verse: Then the Lord said:Because this people draws near to meonly with their wordsand honors me only with their lipswhile their hearts are far from me,and their reverence for me has becomenothing but a human commandmentthat has been memorized,

14.verse: therefore, I will continue to deal with this peoplein shocking and amazing ways.The wisdom of their wise men will perish,and the understanding of their discerning men will cease.

15.verse: Woe to those who go to extreme measuresto conceal their plans from the Lord,who perpetrate their evil deeds in the dark,saying, “Who sees us? Who knows where we are?”

16.verse: Such people are truly perverse.Is the potter no better than the clay?Can what is made say of its maker,“He did not make me”?Can a pot say of the potter,“He really has no particular skill”?

17.verse: Deliverance -It will be but a very short timebefore Lebanon will become a fertile fieldand its orchards will be regarded as forests.

18.verse: On that day the deaf will hearthe words of a book being read,and the eyes of the blind will see,delivered from gloom and darkness.

19.verse: The lowly will once again rejoice in the Lord,and those who are poor will exultin the Holy One of Israel.

20.verse: For the tyrants will be no moreand the arrogant will cease to exist;all those who revel in evil deeds will be destroyed:

21.verse: those whose lies cause a man to be judged guilty,those who set traps to capture just arbitersand thereby deprive the innocentfrom being granted justice.

22.verse: Therefore, thus says the Lord,the deliverer of Abraham,in regard to the house of Jacob:No longer will the house of Jacob be ashamed,nor will their faces grow pale.

23.verse: For when they see in their midsttheir children, the work of my hands,they will acknowledge my name as holy.They will reverence the Holy One of Jacoband stand in awe of the God of Israel.

24.verse: Those who err in spirit will gain understanding,and those who are obstinate will receive instruction.

1.verse: Chapter 30 -Doomed Alliance with Egypt -Woe to the rebellious children, says the Lord,who devise plans that were not in accord with my will,who make alliances that were not inspired by me,thereby adding sin upon sin.

2.verse: They depart for Egyptwithout seeking my counsel,to take refuge in Pharaoh’s protectionand to take shelter in Egypt’s shadow.

3.verse: Therefore, Pharaoh’s protection will be your shame,and the shelter of Egypt’s shadowwill be your humiliation.

4.verse: For though his princes are at Zoanand his envoys have reached Hanes,

5.verse: everyone has been put to shameby a people who cannot be of any use,who afford them neither help nor profitbut only shame and disgrace.

6.verse: An oracle on the beasts of the Negeb:Through a land of hardship and distress,of the lioness and the roaring lion,of the viper and the flying serpent,they carry their wealth on the backs of donkeysand their treasures on the humps of camelsto a nation that cannot be of help to them.

7.verse: For Egypt’s help is vain and futile;therefore I have called her“Rahab the Worthless.”

8.verse: And so go forth and in their presencewrite it on a scroll,inscribe it on a tablet,so that it may serve hereafteras an eternal witness.

9.verse: They are a rebellious people,deceitful children,children who refuse to listento the instruction of the Lord.

10.verse: To the seers they say,“Cease to have visions!”To the prophets they demand,“Do not prophesy to us what is right;reveal to us pleasant things; prophesy illusions.

11.verse: Cease with your warnings;turn aside from the straight path.We wish to hear nothing furtherabout the Holy One of Israel.”

12.verse: Therefore, thus says the Holy One of Israel:Because you have rejected this warning,placing your trust in fraud and deceitand relying on them,

13.verse: this guilt of yours will become for youlike a crack appearing in a high wallthat bulges out and continues to widenuntil suddenly, in an instant,that wall will come hurtling to the ground.

14.verse: It will crash and break like an earthenware pot,shattered so completelythat among its fragments not a single shard can be foundto remove an ember from the hearthor to scoop out water from a cistern.

15.verse: For thus says the Lord God,the Holy One of Israel:Your salvation depends upon repentance and tranquilityand your strength upon quiet trust.But you would have none of it.

16.verse: “No,” you said. “We will flee upon horses.”Therefore, you will flee.“We will ride on swift horses,” you added.But your pursuers will be even more swift.

17.verse: A thousand will tremble at the threat of one;if five threaten you, you will flee,until you are leftlike a flagstaff on the top of a mountainor like a banner on a hill.

18.verse: But even so the Lord is waiting to be gracious to you,and he will rise up to grant you his compassion.For the Lord is a God of justice;blessed are all those who wait for him.

19.verse: O people of Zion who dwell in Jerusalem,you will weep no more.The Lord will be gracious to youwhen you cry out to him for help;when he hears your call,he will answer you.

20.verse: Although the Lord may give you the bread of adversityand the water of affliction,he who is your Teacher will no longer hide himself,but with your own eyes you will see your Teacher.

21.verse: And when you stray from your path,whether to the right or to the left,you will hear his voice behind you,sounding in your ears and saying,“This is the way; continue to follow it.”

22.verse: Then you will realize how uncleanare your silver-plated idolsand your gold-plated images.You will cast them away like polluted ragsand shout at them, “Away with you!”

23.verse: God’s Promise of Prosperity -God will send rainfor the seed you sow in the ground,and the crops that the soil brings forthwill be rich and abundant.When that day comes,your cattle will graze in broad pastures.

24.verse: The oxen and the donkeys that plow the landwill be fed with fodderthat has been winnowed with shovel and pitchfork.

25.verse: On every lofty mountain and on every high hillthere will be streams of wateron the day of the great slaughterwhen the strongholds fall.

26.verse: The light of the moon will match that of the sun,and the light of the sun itselfwill be seven times brighter than before,like the light of seven days compressed into one,when the Lord binds up the wounds of his peopleand heals the injuries inflicted by his blows.

27.verse: Divine Punishment of Assyria -See, the name of the Lord approaches from afar,with burning anger and dense clouds of smoke.His lips are brimming over with anger,and his tongue is like a devouring fire.

28.verse: His breath is like a rushing floodthat reaches up to the neck;it will winnow the nations with the sieve of destructionand place on the jaws of the peoplea bridle that will lead them astray.

29.verse: But as for you, your songs will belike those on the night of a holy festival,and you will experience joy in your heartssuch as occurs when, to the sound of a flute,people make a pilgrimage to the mountain of the Lord,to the Rock of Israel.

30.verse: Then the Lord will make his majestic voice heardand allow his arm to be seenas it descends in furious angerand a flame of devouring fireamid cloudbursts and thunderstorms and hail.

31.verse: Assyria will be shattered at the voice of the Lordas he strikes with his rod.

32.verse: Every stroke that the Lord inflicts upon Assyriawith his punishing rodwill be accompanied by the soundof timbrels and lyresas he engages in battlewith his uplifted hand.

33.verse: The pyre has been ready for a long time,prepared for the king.His pyre is deep and broad,with fire and wood in abundance.And the breath of the Lord, like a steam of sulfur,will set it ablaze.

1.verse: Chapter 31 -Forbidden Alliance with Egypt -Woe to those who go down to Egypt for helpand who rely on horses,who place their trust in a large number of chariotsand in the great strength of their horsemen,but do not look to the Holy One of Israelor seek the Lord’s guidance.

2.verse: Yet he, too, is wise and can bring disaster,and he does not take back his threats.He will rise up against the house of the wickedand against those who come to the support of evildoers.

3.verse: The Egyptians are mortal, not divine;their horses are flesh, not spirit.When the Lord stretches out his hand,the helper will stumble and the one helped will fall;all of them will perish together.

4.verse: This is what the Lord said to me:As a lion or a lion cubgrowls over its prey,and when a band of shepherdsgather together to drive it off,it is not frightened by their shoutingor daunted by their clamor,so the Lord of hosts will come downto do battle on the heights of Mount Zion.

5.verse: Like a hovering birdthe Lord of hosts will protect Jerusalem;he will protect and deliver it,he will spare and rescue it.

6.verse: Come back to the onewhom you have completely deserted,O children of Israel.

7.verse: For on that dayall of you will cast awayyour idols of silver and your false gods of goldwhich your own sinful hands have made.

8.verse: Destruction of Assyria -Then Assyria will fall by a sword not brandished by a manand be devoured by a sword that no human yields;he will flee before the sword,and his young warriors will endure forced labor.

9.verse: His stronghold will be abandoned in terror,and his commanders will panic and desert him.Thus says the Lord whose fire is in Zionand whose furnace burns in Jerusalem.

1.verse: Chapter 32 -A Righteous King -Behold, a king will reign with righteousnessand princes will rule with justice.

2.verse: Each of them will be like a shelter from the windand a refuge from the storm,like streams of water in arid land,like the shade of a great rock in a desolate area.

3.verse: Then the eyes of those who see will not be closed,and the ears of those who hear will listen attentively.

4.verse: The minds of the rash will show good judgment,and those who stutter will speak promptly and clearly.

5.verse: No longer will a fool be called noble,nor will a villain be considered to be honorable.

6.verse: For the fool speaks foolishlywhile his heart is planning evil.He practices ungodlinessand spreads malicious untruths about the Lord.He starves the hungry by withholding their foodand deprives the thirsty of anything to drink.

7.verse: The methods of the scoundrel are wicked,and he devises infamous schemesto destroy the poor with his lieseven when the pleas of the needy are just.

8.verse: But the man who is noble plans noble deeds,and in that respect he stands firm.

9.verse: The Restoration of Jerusalem -Listen carefully to what I have to say,you women who are so complacent.Pay attention to my words,you who feel so secure.

10.verse: In little more than a year from nowyou complacent ones will be shaken.For the vintage will failand there will be no harvest.

11.verse: Tremble, you complacent women;shudder, you who feel secure.Strip yourselves bare,with only a loincloth to cover you.

12.verse: Beat your breasts in mourningfor the pleasant fields and the fruitful vines,

13.verse: for the soil of my peopleovergrown with thorns and briars,and for all the joyful housesin this city of revelry.

14.verse: The citadel will be abandonedand the crowded streets will be deserted;the hill and the watchtower will become wasteland forever,in which wild asses may frolic and flocks may pasture,

15.verse: until a spirit from on highis poured out upon us,and the wilderness becomes an orchardand the fruitful field becomes a forest.

16.verse: Then justice will dwell in the wilderness,and righteousness will abide in the orchard.

17.verse: The effect of righteousness will be peace,and its result will be quiet and security forever.

18.verse: My people will abide in a peaceful land,in secure dwellings and peaceful resting places.

19.verse: Even if the forest were to be totally destroyedand the city were to be completely leveled,

20.verse: how blessed you will beto sow your seed beside every streamand to have your cattle and your donkeys roam freely.

1.verse: Chapter 33 -Overthrow of Assyria -Woe to you, O destroyer,who yourself have not been destroyed!Woe to you, O traitor,who yourself have not been betrayed!When you have finished destroying,you yourself will be destroyed;when you have ceased betraying,you yourself will be betrayed.

2.verse: O Lord, be merciful to us,for we have placed our hope in you.Be our strength every morning,our salvation in times of trouble.

3.verse: At the sound of tumult, peoples flee;nations scatter when they behold your majesty.

4.verse: Your spoil is gathered as if by caterpillars;like a swarm of locusts men descend upon it.

5.verse: The Lord is exalted, for he dwells on high;he has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.

6.verse: Her strength will derive from the Lord’s unchanging stability;her deliverance will result from wisdom and knowledge;her treasure is the fear of the Lord.

7.verse: Listen to the valiant cry aloud in the streets for help;the ambassadors who seek peace weep bitterly.

8.verse: The highways are deserted;no longer are there any travelers on the road.Treaties are broken and their terms are ignored;no one is deemed worthy of respect.

9.verse: The land languishes in mourning;Lebanon withers in its shame.Sharon has become a desert;Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.

10.verse: Now I will rise up, says the Lord.Now I will be exalted,now I will be lifted up.

11.verse: You conceive chaff and give birth to stubble;like fire my Spirit will devour you.

12.verse: The peoples will be burned as though by lime,like thorns that have been cutand consumed in the fire.

13.verse: You who are far away,listen to what I have done,and you who are near,acknowledge my strength.

14.verse: The sinners in Zion are filled with terror;trembling has seized the godless.“Can any of us survive the devouring fire?Can any of us survive the everlasting flames?”

15.verse: Those who walk righteously and speak honestly,who refuse to enrich themselves by extortion,who reject any bribes offered to themand stop their ears from listening to plans for murderand shut their eyes from looking on evil—

16.verse: these people will dwell on the heights;their refuge will be rocky cliffs,where they will have an abundance of food and water.

17.verse: Peace and Prosperity in Zion -Your eyes will behold the king in his splendorand gaze upon a land that stretches far and wide.

18.verse: Your mind will then meditate on the terror.“Where is the man who did the counting?Where is the man who weighed the tribute?Where is the man who counted the towers?”

19.verse: No longer will you encounter the insolent people,those who employ an obscure speechthat you cannot understandand who stammer in a languagethat you are unable to comprehend.

20.verse: Gaze upon Zion,the city of our sacred feasts.Your eyes will behold Jerusalem as a quiet abode,as a tent that will not be moved,whose stakes will never be pulled upand none of whose ropes will be broken.

21.verse: There we will behold the Lord in all his majesty,in a place of rivers and broad streams,upon which no enemy galleys with oars can goor a majestic ship can sail.

22.verse: For the Lord is our judge,the Lord is our lawgiver.The Lord is our king;he is the one who will save us.

23.verse: If the rigging of an enemy ship is loose,unable to hold the mast in placeor to keep the sails spread out,then abundant spoils will be divided;even the lame will carry off the plunder.

24.verse: No inhabitant will say, “I am sick,”for the people who live therewill be forgiven for their sins.

1.verse: The Lord, Zion’s Defender -Chapter 34 -The End of Edom -Draw near, you nations, and listen;pay attention, you peoples.Let the earth and everything in it listen,the world and all that issues forth from it.

2.verse: For the Lord is angry with all the nationsand enraged against all their armies;he has decreed their doomand given them over to slaughter.

3.verse: Their slain will be cast out,and their corpses will emit a stench;the mountains will flow with their blood.

4.verse: All the host of heaven will crumble into nothing,and the heavens will be rolled up like a scroll.All their host will wither awayas the leaves wither on a vineor as the fruit withers on a fig tree.

5.verse: When my sword has drunk its fill in the heavens,lo, it will descend upon Edom,upon a people I have doomed to destruction.

6.verse: The Lord has a sword sated with blood;it is greasy with fat,with the blood of lambs and goats,with the fat of the kidneys of rams.For the Lord has a sacrifice in Bozrahand a great slaughter in the land of Edom.

7.verse: Wild oxen will also be struck down alongside themas will the bullocks with the bulls.Their land will be drenched with bloodand their soil will be greasy with fat.

8.verse: For the Lord has a day of vengeance,a year of reprisal by Zion’s defenders.

9.verse: The streams of Edom will be turned into pitchand her soil into sulfur;her land will become burning pitch.

10.verse: Night or day it will never be quenched;its smoke will rise forever.From generation to generation it will lie waste;never again will anyone pass through it.

11.verse: But the hawk and the hedgehog will possess it;the owl and the raven will dwell in it.The Lord will stretch out over itthe measuring line of chaosand the plumb line of desolation.

12.verse: There will be no more nobles thereto proclaim the king;all of its princes will have vanished.

13.verse: Its citadels will be overgrown with thorns,and nettles and briars will cover its fortresses.It will become an abode for jackalsand a haunt for ostriches.

14.verse: Desert creatures will frolic with hyenas,and wild goats will call out to each other;there, too, the nightjar will return to restand find a place for repose.

15.verse: There will the owl nest and lay eggs,and hatch and gather its young under her wings;there, too, the buzzards will gather,each one with its mate.

16.verse: Consult the book of the Lord and read it.Not one of these will be missing,not one will be without its mate.For the mouth of the Lord has commanded this,and his Spirit has gathered them together.

17.verse: He has allotted the portion for each;his hand has measured out their shares.They will possess it foreverand dwell there from generation to generation.

1.verse: Chapter 35 -God’s Judgment and Promise -The desert and the parched land will be glad.The wilderness will rejoice and blossom.

2.verse: Like the crocus it will bloom with abundant flowersand rejoice with songs of joy.The glory of Lebanon will be given to it,the splendor of Carmel and Sharon.They will behold the glory of the Lord,the splendor of our God.

3.verse: Strengthen the hands that are weak,and make firm the knees that give way.

4.verse: Say to those who are faint-hearted,“Be strong! Do not be afraid!Here is your God;he will come with vengeance.With divine retributionhe is coming to save you.”

5.verse: Then the eyes of the blind will be openedand the ears of the deaf will no longer be sealed.

6.verse: Then the lame will leap like a stagand the tongue of the dumb will shout joyfully.For waters will spring up in the wildernessand rivers in the desert.

7.verse: The burning sand will evolve into a pool,and the thirsty ground will become springs of water.The haunts where jackals used to livewill bring forth grass and reeds and papyrus.

8.verse: A highway will be therethat will be called the Way of Holiness.No one who is unclean may pass over it;it will serve as a path for pilgrimsand no fool will be able to use it.

9.verse: No lion will be there;no ravenous beast will be encountered along it.Such animals will not be seen there;only the redeemed will be allowed to use it.

10.verse: Those whom the Lord has ransomed will returnand come to Zion with songs of happiness,their heads crowned with everlasting joy.Gladness and joy will accompany them,while sorrow and mourning will flee away.

1.verse: Historical Appendix -Chapter 36 -Sennacherib’s Challenge. -In the fourteenth year of Hezekiah’s reign, King Sennacherib of Assyria attacked all the fortified towns of Judah and captured them.

2.verse: From Lachish the king of Assyria sent his chief officer to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem with a great army. When the chief officer took up his position near the conduit of the upper pool on the highway to the Fuller’s Field

3.verse: there came out to meet him Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was master of the palace, as well as Shebna the secretary, and the recorder Joah, son of Asaph.

4.verse: The chief officer said to them, “Tell King Hezekiah: This is the message of the great king, the king of Assyria. On what do you base this great confidence of yours?

5.verse: Do you think that mere words can overcome strategy and military strength? On whom are you relying for help that you dare to rebel against me?

6.verse: This Egypt, the staff on whom you rely, is a broken reed that will pierce the hand of anyone who leans on it. Such is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who rely upon him.

7.verse: And if you say to me that you are relying on the Lord, your God, is he not the one whose high places and altars Hezekiah removed, commanding Judah and Jerusalem to worship at this altar?

8.verse: “Now I challenge you to make a wager with my master, the king of Assyria. I will give you two thousand horses if you can find riders for them.

9.verse: But how could you repulse even a single one of my master’s soldiers, even though you are depending upon Egypt for chariots and horsemen?

10.verse: Moreover, do you believe that I have come to attack this land and destroy it without the consent of the Lord? The Lord himself said to me, ‘Go forth against this land and destroy it.’ ”

11.verse: Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to the chief officer, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it. Do not speak to us in Judean within earshot of the people on the ramparts.”

12.verse: The chief officer replied, “Has my master sent me here to speak these words only to your master and to you, and not also to the people sitting on the wall who along with you will be doomed to eat their own dung and drink their own urine?”

13.verse: Then the chief officer stood up and shouted loudly in the Judean language, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.

14.verse: Thus says the king: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to deliver you.

15.verse: Do not let Hezekiah persuade you to rely on the Lord by saying, ‘The Lord will surely deliver us. This city will not fall into the power of the king of Assyria.’

16.verse: Do not listen to Hezekiah, for thus says the king of Assyria, ‘Make peace with me and surrender. Then each of you will be free to eat the fruit of his own vine and drink the water of his own cistern

17.verse: until I come to take you to a land like your own, a land of grain and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.

18.verse: Do not let Hezekiah mislead you by saying that the Lord will save you. Have any of the gods of the nations saved their lands from the power of the king of Assyria?

19.verse: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they delivered Samaria from my clutches?

20.verse: Which of all the gods of these countries has saved his country from my hand? Will the Lord then save Jerusalem from my power?’ ”

21.verse: However, the people remained silent and did not respond with even a single word, for the king had ordered them not to reply to him.

22.verse: Then Eliakim son of Hilkiah, who was the master of the palace, and Shebna the secretary, and the recorder Joah son of Asaph, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and reported the words of the chief officer.

1.verse: Chapter 37 -When King Hezekiah heard their report, he tore his clothes, wrapped himself in sackcloth, and went into the temple of the Lord.

2.verse: He sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the palace, and Shebna the secretary, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to the prophet Isaiah son of Amoz

3.verse: and gave him this message:“Thus says Hezekiah, ‘Today is a day of distress, of rebuke, and of disgrace. Children come to the moment of birth, but there is no strength to bring them forth.

4.verse: It may be that the Lord, your God heard the words of the chief officer, whom his master, the king of Assyria, sent to taunt the living God, and that he will be rebuked for the words which the Lord, your God has heard. Offer your prayer for the remnant that still survive.’ ”

5.verse: When the ministers of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah,

6.verse: he said to them, “Say to your master, ‘Do not be alarmed because of the words that you have heard with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

7.verse: I will put a spirit in him so that when he hears a certain rumor he will go back to his own country, and there I will cause him to fall by the sword.’ ”

8.verse: Meanwhile, the chief officer returned and discovered that the king of Assyria had departed from Lachish and was fighting against Libnah,

9.verse: since he had heard that King Tirhakah of Ethiopia was on his way to attack him. On learning this, he sent envoys to Hezekiah with this message:

10.verse: “Thus shall you say to King Hezekiah of Judah: ‘Do not let your God upon whom you rely deceive you with the promise that Jerusalem will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.

11.verse: You yourself must have learned by now what the kings of Assyria have done to all the other countries, subjecting them to complete destruction. Will you then be delivered?

12.verse: Did the gods of the nations whom my ancestors destroyed deliver them: Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the people of Eden who were living in Telassar?

13.verse: Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, the king of Lair, Sepharvaim, Hena, or Ivvah?’ ”

14.verse: Hezekiah took the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it.

15.verse: Then he went up to the temple of the Lord and, spreading it out before him, he prayed to the Lord:

16.verse: “O Lord of hosts, God of Israel, enthroned upon the cherubim, you alone are God of all the kingdoms of the world. You have created the heavens and the earth.

17.verse: Incline your ear, O Lord, and listen; open your eyes, O Lord, and see. Hear all the words of Sennacherib whose purpose is to taunt the living God.

18.verse: Truly, O Lord, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the nations and their lands.

19.verse: They have cast their gods into the fire because they were not truly gods but the work of human hands, fashioned from wood and stone—and so they were destroyed.

20.verse: Therefore, O Lord, our God, save us from his hands so that all the kingdoms of the earth will know that you alone, O Lord, are God.”

21.verse: Sennacherib’s Punishment. -Then Isaiah, the son of Amoz, sent the following message to Hezekiah: “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: In answer to your prayer to me requesting help against King Sennacherib of Assyria,

22.verse: this is the pronouncement that the Lord has made in regard to him:“The virgin daughter of Ziondespises you and scorns you.While you retreat the daughter of Jerusalemtosses her head at you.

23.verse: Whom have you insulted and blasphemed?Against whom have you raised your voice,and haughtily lifted up your eyes?Against the Holy One of Israel!

24.verse: Through your servants you have insulted the Lordand boasted: ‘With my many chariotsI have ascended the mountain heights,the farthest peaks of Lebanon.I have felled its tallest cedars,its finest cypresses.I have reached its highest peakand its most luxuriant forest.

25.verse: I have dug wells in foreign landsand drunk the water there,and with the soles of my feetI have dried up all the rivers of Egypt.’

26.verse: “Have you not heardthat I devised this plan long ago?I planned it from days of old,and now I have brought this to fruition:you have reduced your fortified citiesinto heaps of rubble,

27.verse: while their inhabitants, shorn of strength,are dismayed and frustrated;they have become like plants of the field,like tender green herbs,like grass on housetops and fieldsscorched by the east wind.

28.verse: “I know when you stand or sit,I know when you come in or go out,and I am aware how you rage against me.

29.verse: Because you have raged against meand your arrogance has reached my ears,I will put my hook in your noseand my bit in your mouthand force you to returnby the way you came.

30.verse: This will be the sign for you:This year you will eat what grows by itself,and in the second year what springs forth from that.However, in the third year sow and reap,plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

31.verse: The surviving remnant of the house of Judahwill again take root belowand bear fruit above.

32.verse: For out of Jerusalem will come forth a remnant,and from Mount Zion a band of survivors.The zeal of the Lord of hosts will do this.

33.verse: “Therefore, this is the word of the Lordin regard to the king of Assyria:He will not come into this cityor shoot an arrow at it;he will not advance against it with a shieldor build a siege-ramp against it.

34.verse: By the way that he came,by that same way he will return;he will not enter this city, says the Lord.

35.verse: I will protect this city and save itfor my own sakeand for the sake of my servant David.”

36.verse: Then the angel of the Lord went forth and struck down one hundred and eighty-five thousand men in the Assyrian camp. When morning dawned, the ground was covered with corpses.

37.verse: Then King Sennacherib of Assyria broke camp and returned home to Nineveh.

38.verse: One day, as he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer slew him with the sword and then fled to the land of Ararat. His son Esarhaddon succeeded him.

1.verse: Chapter 38 -Hezekiah’s Sickness and Recovery. -During that period, Hezekiah fell ill and was at the point of death. The prophet Isaiah, son of Amoz, came to him and said, “Thus says the Lord: Put your affairs in order, for you are about to die; you will not recover.”

2.verse: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord,

3.verse: “I beg you, O Lord, to remember how I have conducted myself faithfully in your presence and have always done what was pleasing to you.” And Hezekiah wept bitterly.

4.verse: Then the word of the Lord came to Isaiah,

5.verse: “Go and say to Hezekiah: Thus says the Lord, the God of your ancestor David. I have heard your prayer and I have seen your tears. Therefore, I have decided to heal you. In three days you will go up to the temple of the Lord, and I will add fifteen years to your life.

6.verse: I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria and defend this city.”[

7.verse: Isaiah replied, “This will be the sign to you from the Lord that he will do as he has promised.

8.verse: I will make the shadow cast by the declining sun on the stairway of Ahaz to turn back ten steps.” And the sun then retreated the ten steps it had previously advanced.

9.verse: Hezekiah’s Hymn of Thanksgiving. -A canticle written by King Hezekiah of Judah after his recovery from his illness:

10.verse: Once I said,“In the noontime of my lifeI must depart.I will be consigned to the gates of Sheolfor the rest of my years.”

11.verse: I said, “I will no longer see the Lordin the land of the living.I will no longer see any of my fellow menas I did when I dwelled in the world.

12.verse: “My dwelling has been torn down and thrown awaylike a shepherd’s tent;like a weaver I have rolled up my lifeand the last thread has been severed.Day and night I am subject to torment;

13.verse: I cry out for help until the dawn.All my bones are crushed, as if by a lion;day and night I suffer in torment.

14.verse: “Like a swallow I twitter;I moan like a dove.My eyes have grown dim looking up to heaven;O Lord, come to my aid in my suffering.

15.verse: Yet how can I complain? What should I say?He himself has done this.I will wander aimlessly for the rest of my yearsbecause of the bitterness of my soul.

16.verse: “However, you, O Lord, are always present to protect me,and you grant life to my spirit;you will restore me to healthand enable me to live.

17.verse: Clearly it was for my benefitthat I suffered such anguish,but you have preserved my lifefrom the pit of destruction,for you have cast all my sinsbehind your back.

18.verse: For Sheol cannot give you thanks,nor can death praise you.Those who go down into the pitcannot hope for your kindness.

19.verse: It is the living, only the living, who can thank youas I am doing today,just as fathers make known to their sonsyour faithfulness, O God.

20.verse: “The Lord is my savior,and we will sing to stringed instrumentsall the days of our livesin the house of the Lord.”

21.verse: Isaiah thereupon ordered a poultice of figs to be prepared and applied to the boil so that Hezekiah might recover.

22.verse: Then Hezekiah asked, “What is the sign to confirm that I will go up to the temple of the Lord?”]

1.verse: Chapter 39 -Hezekiah’s Foolishness. -At that time the king of Babylon, Merodach-baladan, the son of Baladan, sent envoys with letters and a gift to Hezekiah, for he heard that Hezekiah had been ill but had recovered.

2.verse: Hezekiah was delighted at this, and therefore he showed the envoys his entire treasury: the silver, the gold, the spices, the precious oil, his entire armory, and all that was in his storerooms. There was nothing in his palace or in his entire realm that Hezekiah did not show them.

3.verse: Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and said to him, “What did these men say to you? Where did they come from?” Hezekiah replied, “They came to me from a distant country, from Babylon.”

4.verse: Isaiah then asked him, “What did they see in your palace?” Hezekiah said, “They have seen everything in my palace. There is nothing in my storerooms that I did not show them.”

5.verse: Thereupon Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord of hosts.

6.verse: Behold, the days are coming, says the Lord, when everything in your palace, and everything that your ancestors have stored up until this day, will be carried off to Babylon. Nothing will be left.

7.verse: Some of your own sons who were fathered by you will be taken away and forced to serve as eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”

8.verse: Hezekiah replied to Isaiah, “The word of the Lord that you have spoken is comforting.” For he thought to himself, “There will be peace and security during my lifetime.”

1.verse: The Book of Consolation -The Lord’s Majesty in Israel’s Liberation -Chapter 40 -Salvation of the Lord -Comfort my people and console them,says your God.

2.verse: Speak tenderly to Jerusalemand proclaim to herthat her time of servitude is overand that her guilt has been expiated.Indeed she has received from the Lord’s handdouble punishment for all her sins.

3.verse: A voice cries out:In the wilderness prepare the way of the Lord;make a straight path in the desert for our God.

4.verse: Let every valley be filled inand every mountain and hill be made low.Uneven ground will be made smoothand the rugged places will become a plain.

5.verse: Then the glory of the Lord will be revealed,and all mankind will see it together,for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.

6.verse: A voice says, “Cry out!”I reply, “What shall I cry out?”“All mortals are grass;they last no longer than the flowers of the field.

7.verse: The grass withers, the flower fades,when the breath of the Lord falls upon them.Surely the people are grass.

8.verse: The grass may wither and the flower may fade,but the word of our God will endure forever.”

9.verse: Climb to the top of a high mountain,O Zion, herald of good tidings.Cry out as loudly as you can,O Jerusalem, herald of good news.Lift up your voice without fearand proclaim to the cities of Judah,“Here is your God!”

10.verse: See the Lord God approaching with power,he who rules with his powerful arm.His reward is with himand his recompense is before him.

11.verse: He will feed his flock like a shepherd,and in his arms he will gather the lambs,carrying them in his bosomand gently leading the pregnant ewes to water.

12.verse: The Creator’s Power To Save His People -Who has measured the waters of the seain the hollow of his hand,or marked off the heavenswith the breadth of his hand?Who has held the dust of the earth in a measureand weighed the mountains in scalesand the hills in a balance?

13.verse: Who has directed the Spirit of the Lord?What counselor dared to instruct him?

14.verse: Whom did he consult to gain enlightenment?Who taught him the path of justice?Who taught him knowledgeor showed him the way of understanding?

15.verse: In his eyes the nations arelike a drop in a bucket,like dust on the scales.To him coasts and islandsweigh no more than fine dust,

16.verse: Lebanon would not supply enough wood for fuel,nor are its animals sufficient for a burnt offering.

17.verse: All the nations are as naught in his sight;he reckons them as nothing and void.

18.verse: To whom then will you compare God?To what image can you liken him?

19.verse: Perhaps an idol that a craftsman castsand a goldsmith overlays with goldand for which he fashions silver chains?

20.verse: Or should mulberry wood be chosen,a wood that will not rot,and then a skilled artisan be designatedto fashion an idol that will not fall over?

21.verse: Do you not know?Have you not heard?Were you not told from the beginning?Have you not understood from the foundation of the earth?

22.verse: God sits enthroned above the vault of the earth,and its inhabitants are like grasshoppers.He stretches out the heavens like a canopyand spreads them out like a tent to dwell in.

23.verse: He brings princes to naughtand reduces the rulers of the earth to nothing.

24.verse: Scarcely have crops been planted or sown,scarcely have their stems taken root in the ground,before he breathes on them and they wither,and storm winds carry them off like chaff.

25.verse: To whom then can you compare me,or who is my equal? says the Holy One.

26.verse: Lift up your eyes to the heavens.Who created these things?He leads forth their host and numbers them,summoning them all by name.Because of his mighty power and great strength,not one of them is missing.

27.verse: Why do you say, O Jacob,and complain, O Israel,“My way is hidden from the Lord,and my cause is disregarded by my God”?

28.verse: Do you not know?Have you not heard?The Lord is the eternal God,the Creator of the earth’s farthest boundaries.He does not faint or grow weary;his understanding cannot be scrutinized.

29.verse: He gives strength to the wearyand new vigor to those who are powerless.

30.verse: Even though young men faint and grow wearyand youths stumble and fall,

31.verse: those who place their hope in the Lordwill regain their strength.They will soar as with eagles’ wings,they will run and not grow weary,they will walk and not become faint.

1.verse: Chapter 41 -The Lord Redeems Israel -Be silent and listen to me, O coastlands;let the peoples renew their strength.Let them draw near and speak;let us meet together at the place of judgment.

2.verse: Who has raised up a victor from the eastand summoned him to his service?He delivers up nations to himand overthrows their kings.With his sword he scatters them like dust,and with his bow he reduces them to stubble.

3.verse: He pursues them and advances unscathed,scarcely touching the path with his feet.

4.verse: Who has performed these deeds and accomplished this?Who has summoned the nations from the beginning?I, the Lord, am the first,and I will be there with the last.

5.verse: The coastlands have seen and become frightened;the ends of the earth tremble.These things are fast approaching;they will come to pass.

6.verse: Each worker helps another;they encourage each other to take heart.

7.verse: The craftsman encourages the goldsmith,and the polisher the one who strikes the anvil;he declares the soldering to be good,and he fastens the image with nailsso that it will be secure.

8.verse: But you, Israel, my servant,Jacob, whom I have chosen,the descendants of my friend Abraham,

9.verse: you whom I have taken to myselffrom the ends of the earthand summoned from its farthest corners,to whom I have said, “You are my servant;I have chosen you and will not cast you off.

10.verse: Do not fear, for I am with you;do not be afraid, for I am your God.I will strengthen you and give you help,I will uphold you with my victorious right hand.”

11.verse: All those who rage against youwill be put to shame and disgraced;those who oppose youwill be reduced to nothing and perish.

12.verse: You will search for those who oppose youbut you will not find them.Those who take up arms against youwill be reduced to nothing.

13.verse: For I, the Lord, am your Godand I grasp your right hand.It is I who say to you,Do not fear; I will help you.

14.verse: Do not fear, you worm, Jacob,you maggot, Israel.I will help you, says the Lord;your redeemer is the Holy One of Israel.

15.verse: Now I will make of you a threshing sledge,sharp, new, with numerous teeth.You will thresh the mountains and crush them,and you will reduce the hills to chaff.

16.verse: You will winnow them,the wind will carry them away,and the gale will scatter them.Then you will rejoice in the Lordand glory in the Holy One of Israel.

17.verse: When the poor and needy search for waterand there is none,and their tongues are parched with thirst,I the Lord will come to their aid;I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

18.verse: I will open up rivers on the barren heightsand fountains in the midst of valleys.I will turn the wilderness into a lakeand the dry land into springs of water.

19.verse: In the wilderness I will plant cedars,acacias, myrtles, and olive trees;in the wasteland I will place cypress treesto grow side by side with plane trees and pine trees,

20.verse: so that all may see and know,observe and understand,that the hand of the Lord has done this,that the Holy One of Israel has created it.

21.verse: Present your case, says the Lord.Produce your arguments, says the king of Jacob.

22.verse: Let them bring forth their idolsand reveal to us what is going to happen.What happened in the past?Inform us so that we may reflect on itand that we may know what the outcome will beor declare to us the things to come.

23.verse: Reveal to us what is yet to comeso that we may know that you are gods.Do something, whether good or bad,that will cause us to be alarmed and terrified.

24.verse: But you cannot do so, for you are nothing,and your works are truly worthless.To choose you is an abomination.

25.verse: I have stirred up one from the north,and he has come forth;from the east he has been summoned by name.He will trample on rulers as if they were mud,like a potter treading clay.

26.verse: Who revealed this to us from the beginningso that we might know it,or advised us beforehandso that we might say, “He is right”?No one foretold it, no one proclaimed it,no one has heard you say anything in this regard.

27.verse: I was the first to declare it to Zion,and I sent a bearer of glad tidings to Jerusalem.

28.verse: But when I look around, I see no one;there is not a single one of them to offer counselor to give an answer when I question them.

29.verse: No, they are a delusion.Nothing they do amounts to anything;their idols are empty wind.

1.verse: Chapter 42 -The Mission of the Servant -Here is my servant whom I uphold,my chosen one in whom my soul delights.I have put my Spirit upon him;he will establish justice among the nations.

2.verse: He will not cry out or shoutor make his voice heard in the street.

3.verse: He will not break a bruised reed,nor will he snuff out a smoldering wick;faithfully he will establish justice.

4.verse: He will not falter or become discourageduntil he has established justice upon the earth;and the coastlands wait for his teaching.

5.verse: Thus says God, the Lord,who created the heavens and stretched them out,who fashioned the earth and all that grows in it,who gives breath to the people who dwell on itand spirit to those who walk upon it:

6.verse: I, the Lord, have called you for a righteous purpose;I have taken you by the hand.I have formed you and established youto be a covenant to the peopleand a light to the nations,

7.verse: to open the eyes of the blind,and to lead captives out of prison,and to release from the dungeonthose who live in darkness.

8.verse: I am the Lord; that is my name.My glory I do not grant to another,nor my praise to idols.

9.verse: Behold, the earlier prophecies have come to pass,and now I will reveal new things.Before they actually occur,I will announce them to you.

10.verse: Israel Saved despite Its Sins -Sing to the Lord a new song,his praise from the ends of the earth.Let the sea resound and all that fills it,the coastlands and all its inhabitants.

11.verse: Let the desert and its towns rejoice,the villages where Kedar dwells.Let the inhabitants of Sela sing for joy;let them shout from the top of the mountains.

12.verse: Let them all give glory to Godand sing his praise in the coastlands.

13.verse: The Lord marches forth like a hero;like a warrior he stirs up his fury.He shouts forth his battle cryand triumphs against his foes.

14.verse: For a long time I have restrained myself;I have maintained my silence and held my peace.Now I will cry out like a woman in labor,gasping and panting.

15.verse: I will lay waste mountains and hillsand dry up all their vegetation.I will convert rivers into islandsand dry up the pools.

16.verse: I will lead the blindand guide them along paths they do not know.I will turn darkness into light before themand make straight their winding roads.These are the things I will do for them,and I will not forsake them.

17.verse: But those who place their trust in idolsand who say to carved images,“You are our gods,”will be turned back in bitter shame.

18.verse: You who are deaf, listen!You who are blind, look and see!

19.verse: Who is so blind as my servant,or so deaf as the messenger I send?Who is so blind as the one dedicated to my service,or so deaf as the servant of the Lord?

20.verse: You have seen many things without comprehending them;your ears are open but you do not hear.

21.verse: For the sake of his justice the Lord was pleasedto make his law great and glorious.

22.verse: But this is a people despoiled and plundered,all of them trapped in holesand hidden away in dungeons.They have been pillaged with no one to rescue them;they are plundered with no one to demand their release.

23.verse: Who among you will pay heed to this?Who will pay attention and listen in the future?

24.verse: Who handed over Jacob to be plundered,who gave up Israel to be despoiled?Was it not the Lord,against whom we have sinned?They refused to walk in his ways,and they would not obey his laws.

25.verse: Therefore, he poured out upon themhis blazing anger and the fury of battle.It enveloped them in flames,but they did not understand,it burned them,but they did not take it to heart.

1.verse: Chapter 43 -Redemption and Restoration Promised -But now this is the word of the Lord,he who created you, O Jacob,and formed you, O Israel.Have no fear, for I have redeemed you.I have called you by name; you are mine.

2.verse: When you pass through the waters,I will be with you;nor will the waters engulf you.When you walk through fire,you will not be burned;the flames will not consume you.

3.verse: For I am the Lord, your God,the Holy One of Israel, your savior.I give Egypt as your ransom,Ethiopia and Seba in exchange for you.

4.verse: Because in my eyes you are precious,because you are honored and I love you,I will give people in exchange for youand nations in return for your life.

5.verse: Do not be afraid, for I am with you.I will bring your offspring from the east,and from the west I will gather you.

6.verse: I will say to the north, “Give them up,”and to the south, “Do not hold them back.”Bring back my sons from afarand my daughters from the ends of the earth—

7.verse: everyone who bears my name,whom I created for my glory,whom I formed and made.

8.verse: Bring forth my people,those who have eyes yet are blind,those who have ears yet are deaf.

9.verse: Let all the nations gather togetherand let the peoples assemble.Who among them foretold thisand proclaimed to us former events?Let them produce witnesses to prove themselves right;let those who hear them say, “It is true!”

10.verse: You are my witnesses, says the Lord,and my servants whom I have chosen,so that you may know and believe in meand understand that it is I.No god was formed before me,nor will there be any after me.

11.verse: I am the Lord,and there is no other servant but me.

12.verse: I have revealed and saved and proclaimed,and not some strange god among you;you are my witnesses to this, says the Lord.

13.verse: I am God, and from eternity I am he;no one can deliver from my hand;no one can overrule or alter what I do.

14.verse: Thus says the Lord, your redeemer,the Holy One of Israel:For your sake I will send an army to Babylonto uproot all the prison bars,and the triumphant shouts of the Chaldeanswill turn to cries of lamentation.

15.verse: I am the Lord, your Holy One,the Creator of Israel, your king.

16.verse: Thus says the Lord,who opened a way through the sea,a path through raging waters,

17.verse: who led out chariots and horsemenand an army of formidable strength,until the enemy lay prostrate, unable to rise,extinguished and snuffed out like a wick.

18.verse: Do not linger thinking about events of the past;consider not the things of old.

19.verse: I am about to do something new.Now it comes to fruition;can you not perceive it?I will make a path through the wildernessand rivers in the desert.

20.verse: The wild beasts will honor me,the jackals and the ostriches,because I will provide water in the desertand rivers in the wastelandwhere my chosen people may drink,

21.verse: the people whom I formed for myselfso that they may proclaim my praise.

22.verse: Yet you did not call upon me, O Jacob;you grew weary of me, O Israel.

23.verse: You have not brought me sheep for burnt offeringsor honored me with your sacrifices.I have not exacted grain offerings from youor wearied you with demands for incense.

24.verse: You have not purchased aromatic cane for meor sated me with the fat of your sacrifices.Rather, you have burdened me with your sins;you have wearied me with your crimes.

25.verse: I, I alone, am the onewho blots out your transgressions for my own sake,and I will remember your sins no more.

26.verse: If you choose to review the past,let us go to trial;state your defense and prove your innocence.

27.verse: Your first ancestor sinned,and your spokesmen rebelled against me.

28.verse: Therefore, I expelled the leaders of the sanctuary,placing Jacob under the curse of destructionand subjecting Israel to scorn.

1.verse: Chapter 44 -Now listen to me, O Jacob, my servant,Israel whom I have chosen.

2.verse: Thus says the Lord who made you,who formed you in the womband will continue to help you:Do not fear, O Jacob, my servant,Jeshurun whom I have chosen.

3.verse: For I will pour down rain on the thirsty landand open up streams on the dry ground.I will pour out my Spirit upon your offspringand my blessing upon your descendants.

4.verse: They will spring up amid the grasslike willows besides flowing waters.

5.verse: One person will say, “I am the Lord’s,”while another will call himself a son of Jacob.And on his hand still another will write “The Lord’s,”and adopt Israel as a surname.

6.verse: The One True God and False Gods -Thus says the Lord, the Lord Almighty,Israel’s king and redeemer:I am the first and I am the last;there is no god but me.

7.verse: Who is like me? Let him stand up and speak.Let him declare it and set forth his evidence.Who in the past has foretold future events?Let him foretell to us what is yet to occur.

8.verse: Do not fear or be afraid.Did I not proclaim all thisand foretell it long ago?You are my witnesses in this regard.Is there any god besides me?There is no other Rock;I am aware of none.

9.verse: All those who make idols amount to nothing, and the images in which they take such pride profit no one. Their witnesses are blind and ignorant, and therefore they become objects of scorn.

10.verse: Who would waste his time in fashioning a god or casting an image that will serve no purpose?

11.verse: All who believe in their power will be put to shame, as will the craftsmen who fashioned them. Let them all assemble and approach me with terror and with shame.

12.verse: The blacksmith fashions an ax over the coals, shaping it with hammers and forging it with his strong arm. Then he becomes hungry and his strength fails, and he becomes exhausted because he has not consumed any water.

13.verse: The woodworker measures with a line and marks out an outline with a stylus. He shapes it with a plane and marks it with a compass. Then he carves it into the shape of a man, comely in appearance and dignity, to be placed in a shrine.

14.verse: He also cuts down cedars or chooses a cypress or an oak that he has allowed to grow strong among the other trees of the forest, and a pine tree that he had planted and the rain has nourished.

15.verse: When such trees are suitable to burn, he can use some of them to keep warm or to bake bread, but with others he fashions a god and worships it, shaping it into an idol and bowing down before it.

16.verse: Half of the trees he uses to burn in the fire to roast meat which he eats and is satisfied, while at the same time he warms himself and says, “Ah, how warm I am from the heat of the fire.”

17.verse: With the remainder he fashions a god, an idol before which he bows down and offers worship. He prays to it and says, “Save me, for you are my god.”

18.verse: Such idols possess neither knowledge nor understanding, for their eyes are shut so that they cannot see, and their minds are incapable of reasoning.

19.verse: Yet such a workman does not have the wisdom or the discernment to reflect, “Half of the wood I have burned in the fire, and I also used its embers to bake bread and to roast meat which I ate. Does it make sense to fashion an abomination with the remainder? Am I right to worship a block of wood?”

20.verse: He feeds on ashes. His deluded mind has led him astray, and he cannot save himself. He will not admit to himself, “What I have in my hand is a fraud.”

21.verse: Remember these things, O Lord,and you also, O Israel,for you are my servant.I fashioned you to be my servant;O Israel, I will never forget you.

22.verse: I have swept away your transgressions like a cloudand your sins like a mist.Return to me,for I have redeemed you.

23.verse: Shout in triumphant joy, O heavens,for the Lord has done this;shout aloud, O depths of the earth.Break forth into song, you mountains,you forests, with all your trees.For the Lord has redeemed Jacoband displayed his glory in Israel.

24.verse: Thus says the Lord, your redeemer,who formed you in the womb:I am the Lord who made all things;by myself I stretched out the heavensby myself I spread out the earth.

25.verse: I frustrate the omens of false prophetsand make fools of diviners.I confound wise menand reveal the foolishness of their thoughts.

26.verse: I confirm the words of my servantsand carry out the plans revealed by my messengers.I say to Jerusalem, You will be inhabited,and to the cities of Judah, You will be rebuilt.I will raise up their ruins.

27.verse: I say to the deep waters, Become dry;I will dry up your rivers.

28.verse: I say to Cyrus, You will be my shepherd,and he will carry out my every wish,so that Jerusalem will be rebuiltand the foundations of the temple will be laid.

1.verse: Chapter 45 -Thus says the Lord to his anointed,to Cyrus whose right hand I have grasped,to subdue nations before himand to remove the armor of kings,opening doors before himand leaving no gates barred:

2.verse: I myself will advance before youand level the mountains;I will tear down bronze gatesand cut through bars of iron.

3.verse: I will give you treasures concealed in darknessand riches hidden away in secret places,so that you may know that I am the Lord,the God of Israel who calls you by your name.

4.verse: For the sake of my servant Jacoband of Israel my chosen one,I have called you by your name,and I have given you a title,even though you do not know me.

5.verse: I am the Lord and there is no other;there is no god besides me.I am the Lord who armed youeven though you did not know me,

6.verse: so that it may be acknowledged from east to westthat there is no god besides me.I am the Lord, and there is no other.

7.verse: I form the light and create the darkness;prosperity and disaster depend upon my will;I, the Lord, do all these things.

8.verse: Rain down righteousness, you heavens;let the skies pour it down from above.Let the earth open upso that salvation may blossom forth,and let justice also spring up;I, the Lord, have created it.

9.verse: Woe to anyone who rises up against his Maker,or to the pot that is displeased with the potter.Does the clay say to the one who molds it,“What are you doing?Your work makes no sense.”

10.verse: Woe to anyone who asks a father,“What are you begetting?”or who says to a mother,“To what have you given birth?”

11.verse: Thus says the Lord,the Holy One of Israel and its Maker:How dare you question me about my childrenor command me regarding the work of my hands?

12.verse: I was the one who made the earthand created mankind upon it.It was my hands that stretched out the heavensand commanded all their host.

13.verse: I have raised this man for the triumph of justice,and I will smooth all his paths.He will rebuild my cityand set my exiles freewithout price or ransom,says the Lord of hosts.

14.verse: Thus says the Lord:The wealth of Egypt, the commerce of Ethiopia,and the Sabeans, tall of stature,will come over to you and belong to you;they will follow you, wearing chains.They will bow down before youand pray to you, saying,“God is with you alone, and there is no other;there is no god aside from him.”

15.verse: Truly you are a God who is hidden,O God of Israel, the Savior.

16.verse: All the makers of idols are disgraced and humbled;they perish in their shame.

17.verse: But Israel is saved by the Lord,a salvation that is everlasting.You will never be put to shame or humiliatedforever and ever.

18.verse: For thus says the Lord,the Creator of the heavens,he who is God,the one who formed the earth and created itand established it;he did not create it to be a wasteland,but a place to be lived in.I am the Lord,and there is no other.

19.verse: I did not speak in secret,in realms of darkness.I did not say to the offspring of Jacob,“Search for me in an empty waste.”I the Lord proclaim the truth;I declare what is right.

20.verse: Gather together and come forth;assemble, all you survivors of the nations.Bereft of knowledge are thosewho parade with their wooden idolsand pray to gods who are unable to save them.

21.verse: Come forward and present your caseonce you have examined the evidence.Who foretold this in ages past?Who revealed it long ago?Was it not I, the Lord?There is no god aside from me,I alone am the righteous God and Savior.

22.verse: If you turn to me, you will be saved,all you ends of the earth,for I am God, and there is no other.

23.verse: By myself I have swornthat the word that issues forth from my mouthis righteous and irrevocable.To me every knee will bow,every tongue will swear,

24.verse: saying, “In the Lord aloneare righteousness and strength;all those who formerly defied himand vented their rage against himwill come before him in shame.

25.verse: Then all the descendants of Israelwill be triumphant and glory in the Lord.”

1.verse: Chapter 46 -The Idols of Babylon -Bel bows down, Nebo stoops low;their idols are borne by beasts and cattle.The images you used to carry on your shouldersare now a burden for weary animals.

2.verse: They stoop and bow down togetherbut are unable to transport their burden safely,and they too move forth into captivity.

3.verse: Listen to me, O house of Jacob,all who remain of the house of Israel,you who have been carried by me since your birthand borne by me from the womb.

4.verse: Even when you reach old ageI will still be the same.Even when your hair is gray,I will still carry you.I have made you and I will uphold you;I will carry you and save you.

5.verse: Whom can you regard as my equal?To whom can you compare me as identical?

6.verse: Some pour out gold from a purseand weigh out silver on the scales.Then they hire a goldsmithwho fashions it into a godbefore which they prostrate themselves in adoration.

7.verse: They lift it to their shoulders and carry it;when they return it to its place, it stands there,unable to budge from the spot.If you cry out to it, it cannot reply,nor can it save anyone from trouble.

8.verse: Remember this and stand firm in your resolve;keep it foremost in your mind, you rebels.

9.verse: Remember the things that happened long ago;for I am God, and there is no other;I am God, and there is no one like me.

10.verse: From the beginning I reveal the end;in advance I foretell what has not yet occurred.I proclaim that my plan will be fulfilledand that I will accomplish my intention.

11.verse: I summon a bird of prey from the east,a man from a distant country to fulfill my purpose.I have spoken, and I will bring it to pass;what I have planned, I will accomplish.

12.verse: Listen to me, you whose hearts are stubbornand who are far removed from deliverance.

13.verse: I will bring near my justice;it is not far distant,and my salvation will not be delayed.I will grant my salvation to Zionand my glory to Israel.

1.verse: Chapter 47 -The Fall of Babylon -Come down and sit in the dust,O virgin daughter of Babylon.Sit on the ground without a throne,O daughter of the Chaldeans.Never again will you be calledtender and delicate.

2.verse: Take the millstone and grind meal;remove your veil,strip off your skirt, bare your legs,and wade through the rivers.

3.verse: Your nakedness will be exposedand your shame will be seen.I will take vengeance,and I will show clemency to no one.

4.verse: Thus says our redeemer,the Holy One of Israel,whose name is the Lord of hosts.

5.verse: Sit in silence and conceal yourself in darkness,O daughter of the Chaldeans.For never again will you be calledthe mistress of kingdoms.

6.verse: Because I was angry with my peopleI profaned my inheritanceand gave them over into your power.You showed them no mercy,and you laid a very heavy yoke on the aged.

7.verse: You said, “I will be a queen forever.”Thus you did not reflect carefully on your actionsor give any consideration to their outcome.

8.verse: Now listen to this, you voluptuous woman,as you sit securely on your throne,thinking to yourself,“I am the only one who matters.I will never be a widowor experience the loss of children.”

9.verse: However, both of these things will befall you,suddenly, in a single day;both the loss of children and widowhoodwill come upon you in full measuredespite all your sorceriesand all your potent spells.

10.verse: You felt secure in your wickednessas you thought, “No one can see me.”But your wisdom and your knowledgeled you astray,and you said to yourself,“I am the only one who matters.”

11.verse: As a result, evil will come upon you,and you will not know how to conjure it away,disaster will befall youthat you will not be able to avert;complete ruin which you did not foreseewill suddenly afflict you.

12.verse: But continue to persist in your spellsand your many sorceriesin which you have placed your confidencethroughout your life.Perhaps you can succeed with them;perhaps you can inspire terror.

13.verse: You have exhausted yourself with consultationsever since your youth.Let the astrologers now come forth to save you,those who seek the future in the starsand who predict at each new moonwhat will befall you next.

14.verse: But they are like stubble;the fire consumes them.They cannot even deliver themselvesfrom the heat of the flames.These flames are not meant to sit beside;these glowing embers are not meant for keeping warm.

15.verse: Of absolutely no use to you are your astrologersupon whom you have depended from your youth.Each of them follows his own path;not one of them can save you.

1.verse: Chapter 48 -A Plea to the Captives -Hear this, O house of Jacob,you who are called by the name of Israel,and who came forth from the stock of Judah,who swear by the name of the Lordand invoke the God of Israelbut not with righteousness or good faith,

2.verse: even though you call yourselves citizens of the holy cityand rely on the God of Israelwhose name is the Lord of hosts.

3.verse: Things that happened in the pastI foretold long before they occurred.These predictions issued forth from my mouth,and I made them known to you;then suddenly I acted and they came to pass.

4.verse: Because I know full well that you are obstinate,with your neck an iron sinewand your forehead firm as bronze,

5.verse: I foretold these events to you long agoand declared them to you before they happenedso that you could not assert, “My idols did them;my carved statue and my molten image ordained them.”

6.verse: You have heard what I said; now consider itand admit the truth of what I have stated.From now on I will reveal new things,hidden things of which you have not been aware.

7.verse: They have just been brought into existence, and not long ago;before today you have never heard of them,so that you cannot claim to have already known them.

8.verse: You neither heard nor knew;knowledge of them never reached your ears before now.For I knew how treacherous you areand that from your birth you were rebellious.

9.verse: For the sake of my name I will restrain my anger;for the sake of my honor I will be patient with youlest I should be tempted to destroy you.

10.verse: See, I have tested you,but not in the manner that silver is tested;I have tested you in the furnace of affliction.

11.verse: For my sake, for my own sake, I do this,for why should my name be profaned?I will not yield my glory to another.

12.verse: Listen to me, O Jacob,and Israel, whom I have called.I am he; I am the firstand I am the last.

13.verse: My hand laid the foundations of the earth,and my right hand spread out the heavens;when I summon them,they all present themselves immediately.

14.verse: Assemble, all of you, and listen!Who among the idols has revealed what will happen—that he whom I love will do my willagainst Babylon and the Chaldeans?

15.verse: I myself have spoken and summoned him;I have brought him,and his mission will succeed.

16.verse: Draw near to me and hear this:From the very beginningI have not spoken in secret.From the time it came to be, I have been there.Now the Lord God has sent me and his Spirit.

17.verse: Thus says the Lord God,your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel:I am the Lord, your Godwho teaches you what is for your own goodand who leads you in the way you should go.

18.verse: If only you had listened to my commandments,your prosperity would have been like a riverand your success like the waves of the sea.

19.verse: Your descendants would have been as numerous as the sandand your offspring like its countless grains.Their name would never be erasedor blotted out from my sight.

20.verse: Go forth from Babylon! Flee from Chaldea!Proclaim this with shouts of joyand make it known.Send the message to the ends of the earth and say,“The Lord has redeemed his servant Jacob.”

21.verse: Those whom he led through desert landsnever endured thirst.He caused water to flow from the rock for them;he split open the rock and waters streamed forth.

22.verse: Thus says the Lord:There is no peace for the wicked.

1.verse: Expiation of Sin, Redemption of Israel -Chapter 49 -Message to Israel -Listen to me, O coastlands.Pay attention, you distant peoples.The Lord called me before I was born;while I was still in my mother’s wombhe gave me my name.

2.verse: He made my tongue like a sharp swordand hid me in the shadow of his hand.He formed me into a polished arrow,and he concealed me in his quiver.

3.verse: He said to me, “You are my servant,Israel, through whom I will manifest my glory.”

4.verse: I formerly believed that I had labored in vainand had exhausted my strength for nothingand for no discernible purpose.

5.verse: Yet now the Lord has spoken;he formed me in the womb to be his servantso that I could bring back Jacob to himand enable Israel to be gathered to him.For I am honored in the sight of the Lord,and my God is the source of my strength.

6.verse: It is not enough for you to be my servant, he says,to raise up the tribes of Jacoband to bring back the survivors of Israel.I will make you a light to the nationsso that my salvation may reachto the ends of the earth.

7.verse: Thus says the Lord,the redeemer, the Holy One of Israel,to the one who is despisedand whom the people abhor,the slave of tyrants:Kings will rise up when they see you,and princes will prostrate themselves in homage,because of the Lord who is faithful,the Holy One of Israel who has chosen you.

8.verse: The Deliverance and Restoration of Zion -Thus says the Lord:In a time of my favor I have answered you;on the day of salvation I have helped you.I have formed you and have destined youto be a covenant to the people,to restore the landand to allot the desolate heritages,

9.verse: to say to the prisoners, “Come out,”and to those who are in darkness, “Show yourselves.”They will find sustenance along the way,and any bare height will serve as their pasture.

10.verse: They will not hunger or thirst,and neither scorching wind nor sun will weaken them,for he who pities them will lead them,and he will guide them beside springs of water.

11.verse: I will blaze a path through all my mountains,and my roads will be level.

12.verse: Behold, some will come from far away,others from the north and the west,and still others from the land of Syene.

13.verse: Sing for joy, O heavens, and rejoice, O earth;break forth into song, O mountains.For the Lord has comforted his people,and he will show mercy to his afflicted ones.

14.verse: But Zion cried out, “The Lord has forsaken me;my Lord has forgotten me.”

15.verse: Can a woman forget the infant at her breast;or feel no compassion for the child of her womb?Even should she forget,I will never forget you.

16.verse: Behold, I have inscribed your nameon the palms of my hands;your walls are continually before my eyes.

17.verse: Those who rebuild you do so far more swiftlythan those who destroyed you.

18.verse: Lift up your eyes and look around you;they are all gathering to come to you.As I live, says the Lord,you will put all of them on like jewels;you will adorn yourself with them like a bride.

19.verse: You had lived in a desolate wasteland,amid devastated ruins.Now the land is too tiny for its inhabitants,while those who destroyed you will be far away.

20.verse: The children born during your bereavementwill say in your hearing,“This place is too cramped for me;make room for me to live in.”

21.verse: Then you will say to yourself,“Who bore these children for me?I was bereaved and barren,I was exiled and repudiated;who has reared them?I was left all alone;where then have these come from?”

22.verse: Thus says the Lord God:Behold, I will beckon to the nationsand raise my signal to the peoples.Then they will bring your sons in their arms,and they will carry your daughters on their shoulders.

23.verse: Kings will be your foster-fathers,and their princesses will serve as your nursing mothers.They will bow down to youwith their faces to the groundand lick the dust from your feet.Then you will know that I am the Lord;those who hope in me will not be disappointed.

24.verse: Can spoil be taken from a warrior,or can the tyrant’s captives be set free?

25.verse: Thus says the Lord:Even a warrior’s captives can be rescued,and booty can be retrieved from a tyrant.I myself will contend with those who oppose you,and I will deliver your children.

26.verse: I will force your oppressors to eat their own flesh,and they will become drunk on their own bloodas if with wine.Then all mankind will knowthat I, the Lord, am your Saviorand your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

1.verse: Chapter 50 -God’s Offer of Salvation Remains -Thus says the Lord:Where is your mother’s bill of divorceby which I repudiated her?Or which creditor of mine was itto whom I sold you?No, you were sold because of your sins,and your mother was repudiated,because of your rebellious acts.

2.verse: Why was no one there when I came?Why did no one answer when I called?Is my hand too short to redeem?Have I no power to deliver?By my rebuke I can dry up the seaand turn the rivers into a desert.Their fish rot for lack of waterand die of thirst.

3.verse: Did I not clothe the heavens in blackand cover them with sackcloth?

4.verse: The Lord God has given methe tongue of one who has been well taughtso that I am able to console the wearywith a message of encouragement.Morning after morning he opens my earsso that I may listen to their concerns.

5.verse: And I have not rebelled,I have not turned away.

6.verse: I offered my back to those who struck me,my cheeks to those who plucked my beard.I did not shield my facefrom insults and spitting.

7.verse: The Lord God is my help;therefore I have not been disgraced.Rather, I have set my face like flint,knowing that I will not be put to shame.

8.verse: He who upholds me is near;thus, if anyone wishes to oppose me,let us confront each other.Is there anyone who has a case against me?Let him come forward.

9.verse: The Lord God is my defender;who then will dare to condemn me?All of them will wear out like a garmentthe moth will devour them.

10.verse: Who among you fears the Lordand obeys his servant’s voice?Who among you walks in darknesswithout any light?Let him trust in the name of the Lordand rely on his God.

11.verse: But all of you kindle a fireand arm yourselves with firebrands.Walk by the light of your fireand the firebrands that you have set ablaze.This is what you will receive from my hand:you will lie down in torment.

1.verse: Chapter 51 -Exhortation To Trust in the Lord -Listen to me, you who pursue justice,you who seek the Lord.Look to the rock from which you were hewn,and to the quarry from which you were dug.

2.verse: Look to Abraham, your father,and to Sarah who gave birth to you.When I called him, he was but one,but I blessed him and made him many.

3.verse: The Lord will comfort Zionand have pity on all her ruins.He will make her deserts like Edenand her wastelands into the garden of the Lord.Joy and gladness will resound in her,thanksgiving and the sound of music.

4.verse: Listen attentively to me, my people,and pay heed to me, my nation.For the law will issue forth from me,and my justice will serve as a light to the nations.

5.verse: My justice will issue forth swiftly,my salvation will appear,and I will judge the nations with my arm.The coastlands and the islandswill place their hope in meand trust in my protection.

6.verse: Raise your eyes to the heavensand gaze down on the earth below.For the heavens will vanish like smoke,and the earth will wear out like a garmentas its inhabitants die like flies.But my salvation will be everlastingand my justice will never cease.

7.verse: Listen to me,you who truly comprehend the meaning of justiceand who have my teaching in your hearts.Do not fear the reproach of othersor allow their reviling to dismay you.

8.verse: For they will be like a garment eaten away by moths,like wool devoured by grubs.But my saving justice will be everlastingand my deliverance for all generations.

9.verse: Awake, awake, O arm of the Lord!Clothe yourself in strength.Awake as in the days of old,in ages long past.Was it not you who hacked Rahab to piecesand pierced the dragon through?

10.verse: Was it not you who dried up the sea,the waters of the great deep,and turned the depths of the sea into a pathfor the redeemed to pass over?

11.verse: Therefore, those whom the Lord has redeemed will returnand enter Zion singing,their heads crowned with everlasting joy.They shall experience joy and gladness,while sorrow and mourning will disappear.

12.verse: I, I alone, am the one who comforts you.Why then do you fear mortal men who must die,human beings who must perish like grass?

13.verse: You have forgotten the Lord, your maker,who stretched out the heavensand laid the foundations of the earth.You are in constant fear every moment of the day,dreading the fury of the oppressorwho is bent on your destruction.But where now is the oppressor’s fury?

14.verse: The oppressed will soon be set free;they will not die in the dungeon,nor will they be without food.

15.verse: For I am the Lord, your Godwho stirs up the sea and makes its waves roar;the Lord of hosts is my name.

16.verse: I have put my words into your mouthand sheltered you in the shadow of my hand,I who stretched out the heavensand laid the foundations of the earth,and who say to Zion,You are my people.
