17.verse: The Cup of Salvation -Awake, awake!Rise up, O Jerusalem!You have drunk from the Lord’s handthe cup of his wrath;and have drained to the dregsthe goblet that causes men to become inebriated.

18.verse: Of all the sons you have brought forth,there is no one to guide you;of all the sons you have reared,there is no one to take you by the hand.

19.verse: Who is there to grieve with youabout the twofold disaster you have suffered?Devastation and destruction, famine and sword:who can comfort you?

20.verse: Your children are lying helplessat the corner of every streetlike antelopes trapped in a net.They are filled with the wrath of the Lord,with the rebuke of your God.

21.verse: Therefore, hear this, you who are afflicted,you who are drunk although not with wine.

22.verse: Thus says your sovereign Lord,your God who defends his people:I have taken from your handthe cup of inebriation;you will never again drinkfrom the bowl of my wrath.

23.verse: I will hand it over to your tormentors,those who said to you,“Lie on the groundso that we may walk over you.”And you flattened your backlike ground beneath their feet,like a road for them to walk on.

1.verse: Chapter 52 -The Joy of Zion -Awake, awake!Clothe yourself in strength, O Zion.Put on your glorious garments,O Jerusalem, the holy city.For the uncircumcised and the uncleanwill no longer enter you.

2.verse: Shake off the dust from yourself and rise upO captive Jerusalem.Remove the chains from your neck,O captive daughter of Zion.

3.verse: For thus says the Lord:You were sold for nothingand you will be redeemed without money.

4.verse: Then the Lord God continues:Long ago my people went down to Egyptand settled there as aliens;the Assyrians also oppressed them without cause.

5.verse: Therefore, says the Lord,what should now be done?My people have been carried off without cause;their rulers boast triumphantly,and my name is constantly reviledthroughout the day, declares the Lord.

6.verse: Therefore, on that day,my people will know my nameand understand that it is I who say:Here I am!

7.verse: How beautiful upon the mountainsare the feet of the messenger who announces peace,who bears good news and proclaims glad tidings,announcing salvation and saying to Zion,“Your God is king.”

8.verse: Listen! Your watchmen raise a cryand together they shout for joy,for with their own eyes they clearly beholdthe return of the Lord to Zion.

9.verse: Burst forth together with songs of joy,you ruins of Jerusalem.For the Lord has comforted his people;he has redeemed Jerusalem.

10.verse: The Lord has bared his holy armin the sight of all the nations.All the ends of the earth will seethe salvation of our God.

11.verse: Depart, depart! Leave that place behind!Touch nothing that is unclean.Go forth from its midst and purify yourselves,you who carry the vessels of the Lord.

12.verse: But you need not rush forth in haste,nor should you take flight like fugitives.For the Lord will go before you,and your rear guard will be the God of Israel.

13.verse: Humiliation and Triumph of the Lord’s Servant -Behold, my servant will prosper;he will be exalted and raised to great heights.

14.verse: Just as many people recoiled at the sight of him—he was so disfiguredthat he no longer appeared to be human—

15.verse: so will he startle many nations,and kings will be speechless before him.For they will see what they had not been told,and they will contemplatewhat they had not previously heard.

1.verse: Chapter 53 -Who has believed what we have heard?And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?

2.verse: He grew up before him like a sapling,like a shoot in arid ground.He had no beauty or majestythat would cause us to look at him;nothing in his appearance would attract us to him.

3.verse: He was despised and shunned by others,a man of sorrows who was no stranger to suffering.We loathed him and regarded him as of no account,as one from whom men avert their gaze.

4.verse: Although it was our afflictions that he bore,our sufferings that he endured,we thought of him as stricken,as struck down by God and afflicted.

5.verse: But he was pierced for our offensesand crushed for our iniquity;the punishment that made us whole fell upon him,and by his bruises we have been healed.

6.verse: We had all gone astray like sheep,each of us following his own way,but the Lord laid upon himthe guilt of us all.

7.verse: Although harshly treated and afflicted,he did not open his mouth.Like a lamb led to the slaughterand like a sheep that keeps silent before its shearers,he did not open his mouth.

8.verse: Unjustly condemned, he was taken away,and who gave any thought to his future?For he was cut off from the land of the livingand stricken for the sins of his people.

9.verse: They assigned him a grave with the wickedand a burial place with evildoers,even though he had done no act of violencenor had he ever spoken deceitfully.

10.verse: Yet it was the will of the Lordto crush him with pain.For if he gives his life as a sacrifice for sin,he will see his offspring and prolong his life,and through him the will of the Lord will be accomplished.

11.verse: As a result of his anguishmy servant will behold the light and be content.Through his humiliation he will justify many,and their guilt he will bear.

12.verse: Therefore, I will allot him a portion among the great,and he will divide the spoils with the mighty,because he exposed himself to deathand was counted among the transgressors,even though he bore the sins of manyand interceded for the transgressors.

1.verse: Chapter 54 -The New Zion -Sing with happiness,you barren woman who never bore a child.Burst forth in shouts of joy,you who never have been in labor.For more numerous are the children of the deserted wifethan are the children of the wedded wife,says the Lord.

2.verse: Enlarge the site for your dwellingand stretch out your tent curtainsto the greatest possible extent.Lengthen your ropesand strengthen your tent stakes.

3.verse: For you will spread outto the right and to the left;your descendants will dispossess the nationsand settle in the desolate cities.

4.verse: Have no fear, for you will not be put to shame;do not be discouraged, for you will not be humiliated.You will forget the shame of your youth,and you will no longer rememberthe reproach of your widowhood.

5.verse: For your Creator has now become your husband;his name is the Lord of hosts.The Holy One of Israel is your redeemer;he is called the God of the entire world.

6.verse: The Lord has called you backlike a forsaken wife grieved in spirit,like the repudiated wife of a man’s youth,says your God.

7.verse: For a brief moment I did forsake you,but with great compassion I will take you back.

8.verse: In an outburst of angerI hid my face from you for a moment,but with everlasting loveI will have compassion on you,says the Lord, your Redeemer.

9.verse: This for me is like the days of Noah.Just as I swore that the waters of Noahwould never again flood the earth,so I have sworn that I never will be angry with youand that I will never rebuke you.

10.verse: Although the mountains may be shakenand the hills may totter,my steadfast love will not depart from you,and my covenant of peace will never be shaken,says the Lord who has compassion on you.

11.verse: O afflicted city, storm-battered and not comforted,I will build you with precious stonesand lay your foundations with sapphires.

12.verse: I will use rubies to make your battlements,jewels for your gates,and precious stones for all your walls.

13.verse: All of your sons will be taught by the Lord,and great will be their prosperity.

14.verse: With justice you will be established;you will be free from the fear of oppression,and no terror will afflict you.

15.verse: Should anyone attack you,it will not be my doing,and anyone who does stir up strifewill fall before you.

16.verse: It was I who created the blacksmithto blow on the coals in the fireand produce a weapon suitable for its purpose.I also created the ravagerto destroy and wreak havoc.

17.verse: No weapon used against you will prevail,and you will refute every accusationthat is raised in court against you.This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord,their vindication from me, says the Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 55 -An Everlasting Covenant -All you who are thirsty,come to the water;all you who have no money,come forward, buy, and eat.Come, buy wine and milk,without money and without cost.

2.verse: Why spend money for that which is not bread,your wages for that which fails to satisfy.Listen carefully to me, and you will eat welland delight in rich food.

3.verse: Come to me and pay close attention;listen so that you may have life.I will make an everlasting covenant with youto love you with the faithful love promised to David.

4.verse: I appointed him to be a witness to the peoples,a leader and commander of nations.

5.verse: You in turn will summon nations unknown to you,and nations that do not know you will hasten to you,because of the Lord, your God,the Holy One of Israel,for he has glorified you.

6.verse: Seek the Lord while he still may be found;call to him when he is close at hand.

7.verse: Let the wicked abandon their waysand those who are evil their thoughts.Let them return to the Lordso that he may have mercy upon them;and to our God,for he is rich in forgiveness.

8.verse: For my thoughts are not your thoughts,nor are your ways my ways, says the Lord.

9.verse: As the heavens are higher than the earth,so are my ways higher than your waysand my thoughts above your thoughts.

10.verse: For just as the rain and the snowcome down from the heavensand do not return thereuntil they have watered the earth,making it fertile and fruitful,giving seed for the one who sowsand bread for those who eat,

11.verse: so shall my word bethat issues forth from my mouth.It will not return to me unfulfilled,but it will accomplish my purposeand achieve what I sent it forth to do.

12.verse: Yes, you will go forth in joy,and you will be led back in peace.The mountains and hills before youwill burst forth into song,and all the trees in the countrysidewill clap their hands.

13.verse: A cypress will grow in place of the thornbush,and myrtles will come up instead of briars.All this will increase the Lord’s renown,an everlasting sign that will not be cut off.

1.verse: Return of the First Captives -Chapter 56 -The Lord Welcomes All People -Thus says the Lord:Maintain justiceand do what is right.For my salvation is close at hand,and my righteousness will soon be revealed.

2.verse: Happy is the man who does this,the one who holds fast to my instructions,who observes the Sabbath without profaning itand refrains from every evil deed.

3.verse: Let no foreigner who has joined himself to the Lord say,“The Lord will surely exclude me from his people.”Permit no eunuch to believe,“I am nothing but a dried-up tree.”

4.verse: For thus says the Lord:To the eunuchs who observe my Sabbaths,who choose to do my willand hold fast to my covenant,

5.verse: I will give in my houseand within my wallsa monument and a namebetter than sons and daughters.I will give them an everlasting namethat will never be effaced.

6.verse: The foreigners who pledge their allegiance to the Lord,who minister to him,who love the name of the Lordand become his servants,who keep the Sabbath and do not profaneand who hold fast to my covenant:

7.verse: all these I will bring to my holy mountainand make them joyful in my house of prayer;their burnt offerings and their sacrificeswill be accepted on my altar,for my house will be calleda house of prayer for all peoples.

8.verse: Thus says the Lord Godwho gathers the exiles of Israel:There are others whom I will call forthbesides those who have already been gathered.

9.verse: Wicked Rulers -All you wild beasts of the fields and of the forest,come forth and gorge yourselves.

10.verse: Israel’s watchmen are all blind;they perceive absolutely nothing.They are all dumb watchdogsthat are unable to bark,dreaming as they lie there,loving the opportunity to sleep.

11.verse: The dogs have a ravenous appetite;meanwhile the shepherds are never satisfied.They comprehend nothing;each of them goes his own way,all of them interested solely in their own gain.

12.verse: “Come,” says each one, “I will fetch some wine,and we will fill ourselves with strong drink.And tomorrow will be like today,or perhaps even better.”

1.verse: Chapter 57 -Those who are righteous perish,but no one takes it to heart.Those who are devout are taken away,and no one understandsthat the righteous are taken awayto be spared from evil.

2.verse: Those who have walked uprightlyenter into peace;they find rest as they lie in death.

3.verse: The Unrighteous -But as for you, come here,you children of a sorceress,you offspring of an adulterer and a harlot!

4.verse: Whom are you mocking?At whom do you open your mouthsand stick out your tongues?Are you not a rebellious brood,the offspring of liars?

5.verse: You burn with lust among the oaksand under every spreading tree,sacrificing your children in the ravinesand under the clefts in the rocks.

6.verse: The smooth stones of the ravines will be your portion;these are your lot.To them you poured out libationsand brought forth your cereal offerings.Should such acts appease me?

7.verse: Upon a high and lofty mountainyou have placed your bed,and there you went up to offer sacrifice.

8.verse: Behind the door and the doorpostyou have displayed your pagan symbols.Forsaking me, you have uncovered your bed;you climbed into it and opened it wide.You struck a profitable bargainwith those whose beds you love,and you gazed endlessly at their nakedness.

9.verse: You approached the king with oil,having lavished your body with perfumes.You sent forth your procurers far and wide,even to the depths of Sheol.

10.verse: Although exhausted by your endless travels,you never said, “It is useless.”You realized that your desire had been rekindled,and so you never gave up.

11.verse: Whom did you so greatly dread and fearthat you betrayed meand no longer remembered meor gave me any thought?Is it because I was silent for so long a timethat you do not fear me?

12.verse: Now I will expose your conductthat you regard as so righteous.

13.verse: When you cry out for help,your collection of idols will not save you.The wind will carry off all of them;a gentle breeze will bear them away.But whoever makes me his refugewill possess the landand inherit my holy mountain.

14.verse: Compassion for the Afflicted -Then the Lord will say:Build up, build up! Prepare the way!Remove every obstruction from my people’s path.

15.verse: For thus says the One who is high and exalted,who lives eternallyand whose name is holy:I dwell in a high and holy placebut I am with the contrite and the humble,to revive the spirit of the humbleand to revive the heart of the contrite.

16.verse: I will not accuse forever,nor will I always be angry.For then the spirits of the souls that I have madewould grow faint because of me.

17.verse: Because of their wicked avarice I was angry,and I struck them, keeping myself hidden,but they continued on their rebellious path.

18.verse: I saw how they behaved, but I will heal them;I will lead them and fill them with consolation,both them and those who mourn for them.

19.verse: Peace, peace to all, both far and near,and I will heal them, says the Lord.

20.verse: But the wicked are like the restless sea that cannot be still;its waters cast up mud and dirt.

21.verse: There is no peace for the wicked,says my God.

1.verse: Chapter 58 -Proper Fasting -Shout loudly, without holding back.Lift up your voice like a trumpet.Proclaim to my people their wicked deeds,to the house of Jacob their sins.

2.verse: Yet they search for me day after dayin their desire to know my ways,as if they are a nation that adheres to righteousnessand has not abandoned the law of their God.They request that I make righteous judgments,and they long to be near God.

3.verse: They ask, “Why should we fastwhen you do not even notice?Why should we mortify ourselveswhen you pay no heed?”The truth is that on your fast daysyou serve your own interestsand oppress all your workers.

4.verse: Your fasting only leads to quarrels and fightsand lashing out with vicious blows.Such fasting as you currently practicewill not make your voice heard on high.

5.verse: Is this the type of fast that pleases me,a day for a man to humble himself,to bow his head like a reedand lie in sackcloth and ashes?Is this what you call a fast,a day acceptable to the Lord?

6.verse: This rather is the type of fast that I wish:to loosen the fetters of injustice,to undo the thongs of the yoke,to set free those who are oppressedand to break every yoke,

7.verse: to share your bread with the hungryand to offer shelter to the homeless poor,to clothe the naked when you behold themand not turn your back on your own kin.

8.verse: Then your light will break forth like the dawn,and your wound will quickly be healed;your righteousness will go before you,and the glory of the Lord will be your rear guard.

9.verse: Then, when you call, the Lord will answer;you will cry out for help,and he will say, “Here I am.”If you cease to tolerate the yoke of oppression,the pointing of fingers and malicious words,

10.verse: if you offer your food to the hungryand satisfy the needs of the afflicted,then your light will rise in the darkness,and your night will become like midday.

11.verse: The Lord will guide you continuallyand satisfy your needs in the barren desert.He will strengthen your limbs,and you will be like a watered garden,like a spring whose waters never run dry.

12.verse: Your ancient ruins will be rebuilt,constructed on foundations from generations past.You will be called the rebuilder of broken wallsand the restorer of ruined streets and dwellings.

13.verse: If you refrain from traveling on the Sabbathand from engaging in your own interests on my holy day,if you call the Sabbath a day of joyand regard the Lord’s holy day as honorable,if you honor it by not going your own way,serving your own interests,or attending to your own affairs;

14.verse: then you will find true happiness in the Lord,and I will enable you to rideupon the heights of the earth.I will nourish you with the heritage of your father Jacob,for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.

1.verse: Chapter 59 -Sin and Repentance -Truly the arm of the Lord is not too short to save,nor is his ear too dull to hear.

2.verse: Rather, it is your iniquities that have been barriersbetween you and your God.Your sins have caused him to hide his faceso that he does not hear you.

3.verse: For your hands are stained with bloodand your fingers with guilt.Your lips utter liesand your tongue mutters wicked things.

4.verse: No one brings a suit justlyor pleads honestly in court.They all rely on empty words and utter lies;they conceive mischief and bring forth evil.

5.verse: They hatch adders’ eggsand weave the spider’s web;whoever eats their eggs will die;crush one and a viper emerges.

6.verse: Their webs are useless for clothing;what they make cannot serve to cover them.Their works are deeds of evil,and acts of violence flow from their hands.

7.verse: Their feet rush headlong to do evil,and they do not hesitate to shed innocent blood.Their thoughts are those of iniquity;their paths are marked by havoc and ruin.

8.verse: They do not know the way of peace,and justice is not seen along their paths.The roads they follow are crooked,and no one who travels on them knows any peace.

9.verse: Therefore, justice is far removed from us,and righteousness is far beyond our reach.We look for light but behold only darkness,for brightness but we walk in gloom.

10.verse: Like blind men we grope along a wall,feeling our way like those bereft of eyes.We stumble at noon as if it were twilight;in the midst of the strong we are like the dead.

11.verse: All of us growl like bears;like doves we continue to moan mournfully.We wait for justice but receive none,for deliverance but it is far from us.

12.verse: For our transgressions against you are numerous,and our sins bear witness against us.We are unable to forget our offenses,and we are well aware of our iniquities:

13.verse: our rebellion and our denial of the Lordand our turning away from following him,threatening acts of oppression and revolt,and uttering lies conceived in our hearts.

14.verse: Justice has been rebuffedand righteousness stands at a distance.For truth stumbles in the public squareand uprightness cannot enter.

15.verse: Truth has disappeared,and those who turn from evil are terrorized.Zion’s Redeemer Comes -When the Lord witnessed this, he was displeasedthat justice had ceased to exist.

16.verse: He saw that no help was in sight,and he was outraged that no one sought to intervene.Therefore, his own arm effected the victory,with his righteousness as his support.

17.verse: He put on justice like a breastplateand a helmet of salvation on his head.He clothed himself with garments of vengeanceand wrapped himself in a cloak of zeal.

18.verse: He will repay his enemiesaccording to their deeds:wrath to his adversaries,retribution to his enemies;he will render requitalto the islands and the coastlands.

19.verse: And so those in the west will fear the name of the Lord,and those in the east his glory.He will come like a pent-up streamthat is driven by the breath of the Lord.

20.verse: He will come as a redeemer to Zion,and to those in Jacob who cease to rebel.This is the word of the Lord.

21.verse: As for me, says the Lord,this is my covenant with them:my Spirit which rests upon youand my words that I have put into your mouthwill not depart from your mouthor out of the mouths of your children,or out of the mouths of your children’s children,says the Lord, from now on and forevermore.

1.verse: Chapter 60 -Zion’s Glory Dawns -Arise and shine forth, for your light has comeand the glory of the Lord has dawned upon you.

2.verse: Even though darkness covers the earthand thick darkness enshrouds the peoples,upon you the Lord will shine,and over you his glory will appear.

3.verse: Nations will be guided by your lightand kings by the brightness of your radiance.

4.verse: Raise your eyes and look around;they are all assembling and returning to you.Your sons are coming from far away,and your daughters will be carriedin the arms of their nurses.

5.verse: Then you will be radiant at what you behold,and your hearts will throb and rejoice.For the riches of the sea will be brought to you,and the wealth of the nations will come to you.

6.verse: Droves of camels will cover your land,the young camels from Midian and Ephah;all from Sheba will come,laden with gold and frankincense,while the people proclaim the praises of the Lord.

7.verse: All the flocks of Kedar will be gathered to you;the rams of Nebaioth will serve your needs.They will be acceptable offerings on my altar,and I will enhance the splendor of my house.

8.verse: Who are these that fly along like cloudsand like doves to their dovecotes?

9.verse: All the vessels are assembledfrom the seacoasts and the islands,with the ships of Tarshish in the lead;they are bringing your children from far away,along with their silver and gold,to pay honor to the name of the Lord, your God,the Holy One of Israel,for he has glorified you.

10.verse: Foreigners will rebuild your walls,and their kings will be your servants.Although I struck you down in my wrath,now in my mercy I will show you my favor.

11.verse: Your gates will always be open;day and night they will never be shut,so that the wealth of the nations may be brought to you,led by their kings in triumphal procession.

12.verse: For the nation or the kingdom that refuses to serve youwill be totally destroyedand suffer widespread devastation.

13.verse: The glory of Lebanon will come to you,the cypress, the plane tree, and the pine,one and all,to adorn my holy sanctuaryand to honor the place where I stand.

14.verse: The sons of those who oppressed youwill come forward and bend low before you,and all those who despised youwill bow down at your feet;they will call you “City of the Lord,”“Zion of the Holy One of Israel.”

15.verse: Whereas you have been forsaken and hated,with no one traveling through you,I will make you an object of everlasting prideand a source of never-ending joy.

16.verse: You will suck the milk of nationsand be nursed at royal breasts.Then you will knowthat I, the Lord, am your Saviorand your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.

17.verse: Instead of bronze I will bring you gold,instead of iron I will bring you silver;instead of wood, bronze,and instead of stone, iron.I will ensure that you will be governed in peaceand be ruled with righteousness.

18.verse: No longer will violence appear in your land,nor will devastation and ruin occur within your borders.You will call your walls “Salvation”and your gates “Praise.”

19.verse: The sun will no longer serveas the source of your light by day,nor will the brightness of the moonafford light to you during the night.Rather, the Lord will be your everlasting light,and your God will be your splendor.

20.verse: Never again will your sun go down,nor will your moon withdraw its light.For the Lord will be your everlasting light,and your days of mourning will be ended.

21.verse: Your people will all be righteousand possess the land forever.They are the shoot that I have planted,my handiwork to exhibit my glory.

22.verse: The least of you will become a thousand,and the weakest will become a mighty nation.I am the Lord, and I will accomplish all thisat the appointed time.

1.verse: Chapter 61 -A Message of Consolation -The Spirit of the Lord God is upon mebecause the Lord has anointed me.He has sent me to announce good news to the oppressed,to strengthen the brokenhearted,to proclaim freedom to those held in captivityand release to those who have been imprisoned,

2.verse: to proclaim a year of the Lord’s favorand a day of vengeance for our God,to comfort all who mourn,

3.verse: to give to all those who mourn in Ziona garland instead of ashes,the oil of gladness instead of mourning,a glorious mantle instead of a spirit of despair.And they will be called oaks of righteousnessplanted by the Lord to show forth his glory.

4.verse: Israel’s Reward -They will rebuild the ancient ruinsand raise up sites that have long been desolate.They will restore the ruined citiesthat for generations have been merely ravaged wastes.

5.verse: Strangers will come forth to shepherd your flocks;foreigners will farm your land and dress your vines.

6.verse: But you will be called priests of the Lord;and you will be named ministers of our God.You will enjoy the wealth of the nations,and their former glory will be yours.

7.verse: Because you endured a double measure of shameand were regarded as deserving of dishonor and disgrace,you will receive a double portion,and everlasting joy will be yours.

8.verse: For I, the Lord, love justice,and I hate robbery and wrongdoing.I will be faithful in rewarding such victims,and I will make an everlasting covenant with them.

9.verse: Their descendants will be renowned among the nationsand their offspring among the peoples.All who behold them will acknowledgethat they are a people whom the Lord has blessed.

10.verse: I rejoice in the Lord with all my heart;my soul exults in my God.For he has clothed me in garments of salvationand wrapped me in a robe of saving justice,like a bridegroom adorned with a garlandor a bride bedecked with her jewels.

11.verse: As the earth puts forth its shootsand a garden causes its seeds to sprout,so the Lord God will cause his justice and praiseto spring up in the sight of all the nations.

1.verse: Chapter 62 -Jerusalem, the Lord’s Spouse -For Zion’s sake I will not keep silent,and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not be quiet,until her vindication shines forth like the dawnand her salvation like a burning torch.

2.verse: The nations will see your vindicationand all the kings your glory.You will be called by a new namethat the mouth of the Lord will reveal.

3.verse: You will be a glorious crown in the hand of the Lord,a royal diadem held by your God.

4.verse: No longer will you be called “Forsaken,”nor will your land be known by the name “Desolate.”Rather you will be called “My Delight Is in Her,”and your land will be known as “Married.”For the Lord will take delight in you,and your land will be his spouse.

5.verse: As a young man marries a virgin,so will your builder marry you,and as a bridegroom rejoices in his bride,so will your God rejoice over you.

6.verse: Zion Restored and Glorified -Upon your walls, O Jerusalem,I have stationed sentinels.Neither by day nor by nightwill they be silent.You whose responsibility is to call upon the Lord,give yourselves no rest,

7.verse: and also give no rest to himuntil he restores Jerusalemand makes her renowned throughout the earth.

8.verse: The Lord has sworn by his right handand by his mighty arm:Never again will I give your grainto serve as food for your enemies,nor shall foreigners drink the winefor which you have toiled.

9.verse: However, those who harvest the grain will eat itand give praise to the Lord,while those who gather the grapes will drink the winewithin my sacred courts.

10.verse: Pass through, pass through the gates,and clear a path for my people.Build up, build up the highway;clear it of stonesand lift up a standard over the nations.

11.verse: The Lord has made this proclamationto the farthest bounds of the earth:Say to the daughter of Zion,“See, your Savior comes!His reward is with himand his recompense precedes him.”

12.verse: They will be called “The Holy People,”“The Redeemed of the Lord.”And you will be called “Sought After,”“A City No Longer Forsaken.”

1.verse: Chapter 63 -God’s Judgment of Edom -Who is this that comes from Edom,from Bozrah in crimson garments?Who is this so magnificently attired,marching with his mighty strength?“It is I, proclaiming victory,I who possess the power to save.”

2.verse: Why are your robes red,like the garments of thosewho tread the winepress?

3.verse: “I have trodden the winepress alone;not one of the nations came to my aid.I trod the nations in my angerand trampled them in my wrath.Their blood spurted out all over my garmentsand stained all my robes.

4.verse: I resolved in my heart on a day of vengeance,and my year for redeeming was at hand.

5.verse: I looked all around, but there was no one to help;I was outraged that no one offered any assistance.Even so, my own arm brought me victoryand my wrath sustained me.

6.verse: I trampled down the peoples in my anger;I crushed them in my wrathand sent their blood streaming forth over the ground.”

7.verse: A Plea for Deliverance -I will recount the favors of the Lord,the glorious deeds of the Lord,because of all that the Lord has done for usand the great kindness he has shownto the house of Israel.He has favored us with his mercyand the abundance of his steadfast love.

8.verse: For he said, “These are indeed my people,children who will not betray me,”and he became their Savior.

9.verse: In all their difficultiesit was no messenger or an angelbut he himself who saved them.In his love and his pity he redeemed them;he lifted them up and carried themthrough all the days of old.

10.verse: However, they rebelledand grieved his Holy Spirit.Therefore, he became their enemyand he himself fought against them.

11.verse: Then they remembered the days of oldand Moses his servant.Where is he who brought up from the waterthe shepherd of his flock?Where is he who put his Holy Spiritin their midst,

12.verse: whose glorious arm led themto march at the right hand of Moses,who divided the waters before themto win for himself everlasting renown,

13.verse: and who led them through the depths?Like horses in open country,they did not stumble.

14.verse: Like cattle descending into a valley,the Spirit of the Lord afforded them rest.

15.verse: Look down from heaven and see,from your holy and glorious dwelling.Where are your zeal and your might,your compassion and your tender mercy?Do not withhold them from me.

16.verse: For you are our Father.Although Abraham does not know usand Israel does not acknowledge us,you, O Lord, are our Father;forever you have been called our Redeemer.

17.verse: Why, O Lord, do you allow usto wander from your ways,and harden our heartsso that we do not fear you?Return for the sake of your servants,for the tribes that are your heritage.

18.verse: For a brief period of timeyour people possessed your holy place,but now your enemies have trampled down your sanctuary.

19.verse: For far too long we have beenlike those whom you do not rule,like those who do not bear your name.

1.verse: Chapter 64 -Oh that you would tear open the heavens and come downso that the mountains would quake in your presence,

2.verse: as when fire sets brushwood ablazeor causes water to boil.Thus your name would be known to your adversariesand the nations would tremble at your presence.

3.verse: When you descended to perform awesome deedsthat we did not anticipate,the mountains quaked when you appeared.

4.verse: Throughout the ages no ear has ever heard,nor has any eye ever seen,any other god except youperforming such deeds for those who trust him.

5.verse: You welcome those who lead an upright lifeand rejoice to imitate your ways.When we sin, you become angry,but when we follow your ways,we know that we will be saved.

6.verse: All of us have become unclean,and all of our righteous deeds are like filthy ragsWe all become withered like leaves,and our iniquities carry us away like the wind.

7.verse: There is no one who invokes your nameor attempts to hold fast to you.For you have hidden your face from usand have delivered us up because of our sins.

8.verse: Yet, O Lord, you are our Father;we are the clay and you are our potter;all of us are the work of your hands.

9.verse: Do not let your anger go to extremes, O Lord,and do not remember our sinfulness forever.Look upon us all,for we are all your people.

10.verse: Your holy cities have become a desert;Zion has become a wilderness,Jerusalem a desolate waste.

11.verse: Our holy and glorious templein which our ancestors praised youhas been burned to the ground,and all that we treasured lies in ruins.

12.verse: After all this, will you restrain yourself, O Lord?Will you remain silentand punish us beyond our endurance?

1.verse: Chapter 65 -Punishment of the Idolaters -I was eager to respondto those who did not consult me.I was anxious to be approachedby those who did not seek me.I said, “Here I am! Here I am!”to a nation that did not summon me.

2.verse: Throughout each day I held out my handsand appealed to a rebellious peoplewho walk along evil pathsin pursuit of their own desires.

3.verse: These people provoke me to angercontinually, to my face,offering sacrifices in gardensand burning incense on bricks.

4.verse: They live in the midst of tombsand spend the night in secret places,eating the flesh of pigsand filling their plates with unclean food,

5.verse: as they cry out, “Keep away!Do not touch me,for I am too sacred for you.”Such people to me are like choking smoke,a fire that smolders throughout the day.

6.verse: Their deeds have been inscribed in my memory;I will not remain silent until I have repaid in full

7.verse: your iniquities and those of your ancestors,says the Lord.Since they burned incense on the mountainsand shamed me on the hills,I will measure into their lapsthe full payment that their deeds deserve.

8.verse: Fate of Israel’s Righteous and Unfaithful -Thus says the Lord:As in the harvest of grapesjuice is often still found in the cluster,and people say, “Do not discard them,for some good still remains in them,”so I will act for the sake of my servantsand not destroy them all.

9.verse: From Jacob I will bring forth descendants,and from Judah those who will inherit my mountains.My chosen ones will take possession of the land,and my servants will settle there.

10.verse: Sharon will serve as a pasture for flocksand the Valley of Achor will bea resting place for cattle.

11.verse: However, those of you who forsake the Lordand forget my holy mountain,who spread a table for Fortuneand fill cups of mixed wine for Fate,

12.verse: I will destine you for the sword,and all of you will submit to the slaughter,because, when I called, you did not respond,and when I spoke, you refused to listen.Rather, you did what was evil in my sightand chose to do what displeases me.

13.verse: Therefore, this is what I have decreed,says the Lord God:My servants will eat,but you will go hungry;my servants will drink,but you will be thirsty;my servants will rejoice,but you will be put to shame;

14.verse: with gladness in their heartsmy servants will sing for joy,but you will cry out in heartfelt griefand wail in your anguish of spirit.

15.verse: The Lord God will strike you deadand his chosen ones will use your name as a curse,but he will call his servants by a different name.

16.verse: Then anyone in the land who blesses himselfwill bless himself by the God of truth,and anyone who takes an oath in the landwill swear by the God of truth,because the troubles of the past will be forgottenand hidden from my sight.

17.verse: A Renewed World -For behold, I am about to createnew heavens and a new earth.The past will not be rememberedor ever again called to mind.

18.verse: Rather, rejoice and be filled with delight foreverat what I am creating;for I am about to create Jerusalem as a delightand her people as a cause of joy.

19.verse: I will take delight in Jerusalemand rejoice in my people.No more will be heard therethe sound of weeping or the cries of distress.

20.verse: Never again will an infant be therewho dies after a few days of lifeor an old man who fails to live his allotted days.For one who dies at the age of one hundredwill be regarded as a youth,while one who fails to achieve a hundred yearswill be considered accursed.

21.verse: They will live in the houses they have built;they will plant vineyards and eat their fruit.

22.verse: They will not build houses for others to dwell inor plant for others to eat.For the days of my people will belike the days of a tree,and my chosen ones will enjoythe work of their hands.

23.verse: They will not labor in vainor bear children destined for calamity.For they will be offspring blessed by the Lord,as will their descendants after them.

24.verse: Even before they call out to me,I will answer;while they are still speaking,I will respond.

25.verse: The wolf and the lamb will feed together,and the lion will eat straw like the ox,but as for the serpent,its food will be dust.No harm or destruction will be doneon all my holy mountain,says the Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 66 -True and False Worship -Thus says the Lord:The heavens are my throneand the earth is my footstool.What house could you build for me?What is to be my resting place?

2.verse: All these things were made by me,and so all these things are mine,says the Lord.The one for whom I have regardis humble and contrite in spiritand trembles at my word.

3.verse: Whoever slaughters an oxis like one who kills a man;whoever sacrifices a lambis like one who breaks a dog’s neck;whoever presents an offering of grainis like one who offers a swine’s blood;whoever burns incense as a memorialis like one who blesses an idol.These people have chosen their own ways,and they delight in their loathsome abominations.

4.verse: I in turn will choose to punish them harshlyand bring upon them what they fearbecause, when I called, no one answered,and when I spoke, they refused to listen.Rather, they did what was evil in my sightand chose what displeased me.

5.verse: Hear the word of the Lord,you who tremble at his word.Your brethren who hate youand reject you because of my name, have said,“Let the Lord be glorifiedso that we may witness your joy”;however, they themselves will be put to shame.

6.verse: Listen! There is an uproar from the city,a voice from the temple.Such is the sound of the Lordbringing retribution to his enemies.

7.verse: Mother Zion -Before she entered into labor,she gave birth.Before she experienced the birth pains,she delivered a son.

8.verse: Who ever heard of such a thing?Who has ever seen anything like this?Can a country be born in a single day?Can a nation be delivered in a single moment?Yet Zion was scarcely in laborwhen she brought forth her children.

9.verse: Shall I open the womb and not deliver?says the Lord.Shall I close the womb at the moment of delivery?says your God.

10.verse: Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad for her,all you who love her.Be joyful as you rejoice with her,all you who mourned over her,

11.verse: so that you may suck fully and be satisfiedfrom her consoling breast,as you drink deeply with delightat her abundant bosom.

12.verse: For thus says the Lord:I will make prosperity flow over her like a river,and the wealth of the nationslike a turbulent overflowing stream.You will be nursed and carried in her armsand fondled in her lap.

13.verse: As a mother comforts her child,so will I comfort you;in Jerusalem you will find your comfort.

14.verse: When you behold this, your heart will rejoice,and your bodies will flourish like grass in spring.The Lord will make his power known to his servantsbut reveal his wrath to his enemies.

15.verse: Behold the Lord as he comes in fire,his chariots like the whirlwind,to enact retribution with his furious angerand his rebukes with fiery flames.

16.verse: For the Lord will execute his judgmenton all mankind with fire and sword,and many will be those slain by the Lord.

17.verse: Those who sanctify and purify themselves to enter the groves and follow the one in the center, consuming the flesh of pigs, vermin, and rats—they will all perish together, says the Lord, along with their deeds and their thoughts.

18.verse: Glory among the Nations. -I am coming to gather every nation and every language. They will come forth to behold my glory.

19.verse: I will set a sign among them, and I will send some of their survivors to the nations: to Tarshish, Put and Lud, Mosoch, Tubal, and Javan, to the distant coasts and islands that have never heard of me or seen my glory.They will proclaim my glory among the nations,

20.verse: and from all the nations they will bring all your kindred as an offering to the Lord, on horses and in chariots, in carts and on mules and camels, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says the Lord, just as the Israelites themselves bring their grain offerings in clean vessels to the house of the Lord.

21.verse: Some of these I will appoint as priests and Levites, says the Lord.

22.verse: Eternal Reward and Punishment -As the new heavens and the new earththat I am makingwill endure before me, says the Lord,so will your descendants and your name endure.

23.verse: From new moon to new moonand from one Sabbath to another,all mankind will come to worship before me,says the Lord.

24.verse: And as they go out,they will see the corpsesof those who rebelled against me.For their worm will never die,nor will their fire be quenched,and they will be abhorrent to all humanity.
